loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Natalia is 40 years old and single. She has been running a small convenience store in her house for about six years. She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise such as champagne, stuffed animals, oil, and rice. She is grateful for the opportunity to invest in her business and hopes that her business will continue to be successful in the future.

Natalia is a member of the village bank "Los Hijos de Qolquewasi" in Cusco, which is receiving its 18th loan from Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as champagne, stuffed animals, oil, and rice

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth lives in Kampala, Uganda .She is single with three children and all of her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members (brother’s child). She sells empty jerrycans at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last five years. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy jerrycans for resale. Her major business challenges are the rainy season because she works from an open place and thieves. Her goals and aspirations are to build her own house and to invest in selling second hand clothes.  She lives in a rented house and the family does not have access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, rent, and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans for resale

loans.name: Khaterine Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is 18 years old and single. She has a grocery store in her house, which is open from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. every day. Geraldine would like a loan in order to expand her selection of goods. She mostly sells basic necessities such as sugar, rice, and oil. She hopes that her business will continue to prosper long into the future.

Geraldine is a member of the village bank "Los Hijos de Qolquewasi" in Cusco, which is receiving its 18th loan from Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy grocery merchandise such as sugar, rice, and oil

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana has a shop where she sells fruit such as oranges, mandarins, bananas, and papayas. She is 40 years old and single with three children who are 12, 14, and 16 years old.. Juana has had this business for about 13 years and is requesting a loan in order to purchase school supplies for her children. Her dream is to see them complete their education and attain professional degrees.

Juana is a member of the village bank "Los Hijos de Qolquewasi" in Cusco, which is receiving its 18th loan from Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies for her children

loans.name: Nonvignon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe NONVIGNON est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Goussi Augustine, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Goussi Augustine est âgée de 40 ans et est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Victor. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Goussi Augustine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges. Goussi Augustine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Depuis dix huit ans, Goussi Augustine exerce comme activité, la vente de divers produits (maïs, riz, farine de manioc et des chaussures) dans son quartier. Ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Goussi Augustine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Goussi Augustine désire renforcer ses stocks de produits et rehausser le niveau de son activité. Pour ce faire, Goussi Augustine sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe NONVIGNON, un deuxième crédit auprès de  ALIDé. Le crédit précédent a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
NONVIGNON is a group made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood in Benin.  

The group's representative, named Goussi Augustine, is the woman raising her hand in the photo.  It is the second time that the group is requesting financial support from ALIDé in order to raise their level of activity.  Goussi Augustine is 40 years old and married to a driver named Victor.  The couple has four children, all in school and all their dependents.  Goussi Augustine lives with her husband and children and takes care of the various family expenses with her husband.

Goussi Augustine never attended school.  For the past eighteen years, she has been selling various products such as maize, rice, cassava flour and shoes, in her own neighborhood.  This enables her to meet her family's needs without much difficulty.  Goussi Augustine stocks up at a market in Benin.

As she would like to better meet her customers' needs, Goussi Augustine wants to strengthen her stock of goods and raise her activity level.  To this end, she and the other members of the NONVIGNON group are requesting a second loan from ALIDé.  Their previous loan was well repaid.

loans.use: to buy grains and maize.

loans.name: Ejlominde Group

texts.fr: Le groupe EJLOMINDE est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante de ce groupe, du nom de Afiavi Olga Charlotte est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Afiavi Olga Charlotte est âgée de 36 ans et est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Victor. Le couple a cinq enfants tous scolarisés dont quatre restent à leur charge. Afiavi Olga Charlotte vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Afiavi Olga Charlotte mène comme activité, la coiffure. De façon secondaire,  Afiavi Olga Charlotte vend des mèches et des produits cosmétiques dans son quartier. Afiavi Olga Charlotte achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Afiavi Olga Charlotte sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe EJLOMINDE, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The Ejlominde group is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood. It is the second time that this group has requested financial aid from Alidé, with a view to increasing their business volumes. The representative of the group, whose name is Afiavi Olga Charlotte, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Afiavi Olga Charlotte is 36 years old and married to a mechanic called Victor. The couple has five children who are all studying; four of them remain in their parents' care. Afiavi Olga Charlotte lives with her husband and children. The couple covers the various household expenses between them. In order to do this, Afiavi Olga Charlotte has a hairdressing business. As a secondary activity she sells hair extensions and cosmetics in her neighborhood. She buys her products in a market in Benin. With a view to satisfying customer demand and increasing her turnover and income, Afiavi Olga Charlotte is, together with the other members of the Ejlominde group, requesting a second loan from Alidé. The first loan was repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and cosmetics

loans.name: Nonvigbe-Vinanwamon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe NONVIGBE-VINANWAMON est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Kouessiba Chantal est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Kouessiba Chantal est âgée de 37 ans et vit au Bénin. Kouessiba Chantal n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Kouessiba Chantal est mariée à un certain Timothé. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Kouessiba Chantal vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins de la maison. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille,Kouessiba Chantal vend de repas ( haricot, riz, pâte de maïs) dans son quartier depuis près huit ans. Kouessiba Chantal s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Kouessiba Chantal sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe NONVIGBE-VINANWAMON, un sixième crédit auprès de  ALIDé. Les crédits consentis antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The Nonvigbe-Vinanwamon group is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, whose name is Kouessiba Chantal, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Kouessiba Chantal is 37 years old and lives in Benin. She did not go to school and she is married to a man called Timothé. The couple has two children, who are both at school and in their care. Kouessiba Chantal lives with her husband and children. The couple covers the cost of the various household needs between them. In order to do this, Kouessiba Chantal has been selling meals (beans, rice, corn dough) in her neighborhood for almost eight years. She gets her supplies in a market in Benin. With a view to satisfying customer demand and in order to increase her turnover and income, Kouessiba Chantal is requesting, together with the other members of the Nonvigbe-Vinanwamon group, a sixth loan from Alidé. The previous loans granted have all been repaid correctly.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, beans, corn, condiments and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Une Femme De Plus Ii Group

texts.fr: Le groupe UNE FEMME DE PLUS II est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Victoire est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Victoire est âgée de 47 ans et vit au Bénin. Victoire n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Victoire est mariée à un certain Jean. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Victoire vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Afin d'assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Victoire vend depuis vingt cinq ans, des céréales dans son quartier. Victoire s’approvisionne dans une région du Benin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Victoire sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe UNE FEMME DE PLUS II, un deuxième crédit auprès de  ALIDé.  Le premier crédit consenti a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The "Une Femme de Plus II" group is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, whose name is Victoire, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Victoire is 47 years old and lives in Benin. She did not go to school. She is married to a man called Jean. The couple has three children, who are all at school and in their care. Victoire lives with her husband and children. The couple covers the various household expenses between them. In order to do this, Victoir has been selling cereals in her neighborhood for the past 25 year. She gets her supplies in a region of Benin. With a view to satisfying customer demand and in order to increase her turnover and income, Victoire is requesting, together with the other members of the "Une Femme de Plus II" group, a second loan from Alidé. The first loan granted was repaid correctly.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Rosa Matilde

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 50 años, se considera una mujer emprendedora, honrada, trabajadora y muy feliz. Rosa vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos en la ciudad de Ibarra que se encuentra en la ciudad de Imbabura.

Rosa trabaja sola tejiendo gorras de figuras de lana para niños, negocio que le permite ayudarse económicamente en su hogar y poder seguir dando el estudio a sus hijos. Es el segundo crédito que realiza en Fodemi el mismo que va a ser utilizado en la compra de Lana de varios colores que le permitirá incrementar su producción, mejorando sus ventas y sus ingresos económicos.

Rosa sueña con tener un taller grande y generar empleo para las personas que mas lo necesitan.
texts.en:
Rosa is 50 years old, considers herself to be an ambitious woman, honorable, hardworking, and very happy. She lives with her husband and three children in Ibarra city located in the town of Imbabura.

Rosa works alone sewing hats shaped like different figures for children, a business that helps her support her family financially and continue funding her children's education. This is the second loan she has requested with Fodemi and it will also be used to purchase wool of varying colors to increase her production, improve her sales, and increase profits.

Rosa dreams of having a large shop and offer work for the people that need it.

loans.use: to purchase wool of varying colors to increase her production.

loans.name: Marbellí Del Socorro

texts.es: Marbeli, mujer luchadora, dedicada al porvenir de sus hijos. Hoy en dia se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos de una casa comercial exclusivamente para damas, labor que empezo mediante creditos que la misma empresa les ofrece a sus concejeras de productos. La señora asegura ser una mujer con metas a futuro puesto que se ha propuesto irle realizando las mejoras a su vivienda y lo ha logrado. Siendo Afodenic y su señor esposo los principales medios para ella poder alcanzar uno de sus grandes sueños como es la construccion de su vivienda. Con este su tercer ciclo de credito por lo que propone  realizar el entechado de su porche, esto con el fin de mejorar la presentacion de su hogar y otorgarle a sus pequeños hijos mayor seguridad. Su plan a futuro es seguir mejorando su morada e incrementar sus ingresos, con un negocio mas fluido ya que por ahora su principal fuente de ingreso es el apoyo moral y economico que recibe de parte de su señor esposo quien labora para un taller de torno.
texts.en: Maribel, a hardworking woman, dedicates herself to her children's future. Nowadays, she sells cosmetics exclusively for women a business she started through loans her company offers their consultants. She assures she is a woman with goals since she has made her goals of improving her home a reality. Afodenic and her husband are the main resources to help her make her dream of constructing her home a reality. This will be her third loan cycle and it will be used to build the roof of her porch to give it a better look and protection for her children. Her future plan is to continue improving her dwelling and increase her profits with a more free-flowing business since her main source of income is that of moral and economic support she receives from her husband who works in a lathe workshop.

loans.use: build the roof of her porch

loans.name: Cesar Manuel

texts.es:
César Manuel es un hombre de 31 años de edad, conviviente y con 3 hijas a su cargo. Vive en casa propia en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, con servicio de eletricidad.
La actividad que realiza César es la crianza de cerdos y aves de corral en su domicilio, animales que una vez alcanzados los niveles óptimos en peso y talla, son comercializados en los distintos sectores y en el mercado local. Su conviviente se dedica a la venta de productos naturales, colaborando así con los ingresos de la familia.
El monto del crédito solicitado es de 500 nuevos soles, que serán utilizados para la compra de alimento balanceado para su ganado que posteriormente será comercializado en el mercado local.
texts.en:
César Manuel, 31, lives with his common-law wife and three children in their own house, which has electricity, in the rural area of the district of Tambogrande.  

César raises pigs and poultry on his property and sells them in different areas and at the local market when they reach optimum weight and size.  His wife sells natural products in order to add to the family income.

The loan in the amount of 500 PEN will be used to buy balanced animal feed for his livestock, which he will later sell at the local market.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed for his livestock.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.es: Angelina es habitante de la comarca Los Ranchito, posee una pequeña finca donde desarrolla su trabajo en los rubro agricola y ganaderia, obteniendo ingreso de la comercializaciòn de la venta de leche, ganado desarrollo, granos bàsico y raices y tuberculos, ademas tiene otros ingreso del acopio de leche en su comunidad,  de todos los productores; esta solicitando credito para compra de terneros los cuales pretende cuidar para engorde y desarrollo y posteriormente venderlos a un buen precio, donde obtenga ganancias que le permitan mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Angelina lives in Los Ranchito county where she works in agriculture and livestock farming.  She earns an income selling milk, cattle, basic grains, roots and tubers; and also receives an income from the community milk collectors and producers.  

She is requesting a loan to buy calves which, once they reach full development, will be sold for a good price, giving her the earnings to live a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy calves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his crop and animal feed.

loans.name: Aida Mercedes

texts.es: Aida Mercedes es casada, tiene 5 hijos, trabaja para el MINED como docente, desarrolla su laboriosa actividad con niños de las comunidades de la colonia La Fonseca, su esposo le apoya para gastos del hogar, solicita segundo crèdito para realizar mejora en su casa de habitaciòn, reparando el techo que esta en mal estado; su mayor sueño es de tener su casa bonita con condiciones y tener mejor calidad de vida y salud,  doña Aida Mercedes esta agradecida con AFODENIC ya que ha salido satisfactorio en su crèdito y de esta manera ha realizado la mejora en su finca, es un mujer luchadora, con buena conducta, responsable, posee capacidad y voluntad de pago.
texts.en:
Aida Mercedes is married and has five children.  She works for the MINED as a teacher and carries out her laborious activity with the children in the communities of La Fonseca Community.  Her husband helps cover the household expenses. She is requesting her second loan for home improvement to repair the roof which is in disrepair.  Her greatest dream is to have a nice, comfortable house and a better quality of life and health.

Doña Aida Mercedes is grateful to AFODENIC for the loan used to improve her house.  She is a hard-working woman who is well-mannered, responsible and has the capacity and willingness to pay back the loan.

loans.use: To repair her roof.

loans.name: Ilhomidin

texts.ru: Илхомидин добрый и трудолюбивый человек, который более 6 лет занимается выращиванием сельхозкультур. Он женат и на воспитании имеет пятерых детей. Илхомидин хочет улучшить свое жилищные условия для того чтобы создать условию для своей семьи. Илхомидин запрашивает займ в размере 3000$ США для покупки минеральных удобрений и горюче-смазочных материалов.
texts.en: Ilhmodin is a kind and hard-working person who has been working as a farmer for over six years. He is married and raising five children. Ilhomdin would like to improve his housing conditions in order to improve his family's life. He is requesting a loan of $3000 in order to buy mineral fertilizers, fuel and lubricants.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers, fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Annes Narcisa

texts.es:
Annes es una mujer de 45 años, se describe como una persona de buen caracter, que no le gusta las cosas injustas y es muy amigables. Annes vive con su esposo y sus hijos en Atuntaqui que se encuentra a veinte minutos de Otavalo en la Provincia de Imbabura.

Annes trabaja en la compra venta de ropa interior como medias, este negocio le ayuda mucho porque colabora a su marido a sustentar los gastos de estudio de sus hijos y necesidades varias de su hogar. Es la primera vez que trabaja con Fodemi, el crédito va a invertir en la compra de mercadería como medias e interiores para seguir con su negocio de compra venta ya que lo realiza constantemente.

Annes sueña que sus hijos puedan terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Annes, 45, describes herself as a cheerful and friendly person, but someone who does not like things that are unfair.  Annes lives with her husband and children in Atuntaqui which is 20 minutes from Otavalo in the province of Imbabura.

Annes works selling underwear such as socks.  The business has allowed her to help her husband cover expenses related to their childrens' education and to the various household needs.  This is her first experience with Fodemi and she plans to use the loan to buy merchandise such as socks and underwear to continue with her sales business.

Annes' goal is for her children to finish their education.

loans.use: To buy socks and underwear to sell.

loans.name: Houenoussou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe HOUENOUSSOU est composé de trois personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Pélagie est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Pélagie est âgée de 37 ans et vit au Bénin. Pélagie est mariée à un mécanicien auto du nom de Lazare. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Pélagie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure avec son mari les diverses charges de la maison. Afin d'assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Pélagie vend depuis cinq ans, des ustensiles de cuisine dans une ville du Benin. Pélagie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin et parfois à Lomé. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Pélagie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe HOUENOUSSOU, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit leur permettra de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et de se faire plus de profit. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The Houenoussou Group is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood. This is the second time that this group is seeking the financial assistance of Alidé in order to increase their business. The group's representative, named Pélagie, is the woman who has her hand raised in the photo.

Pélagie is 37 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to an auto mechanic named Lazare. The couple has three children, all enrolled in school and under their care. Pélagie lives with her husband and children and, with her husband, takes care of the various household expenses.

In order to see to the various expenses of the family, Pélagie has been selling kitchen utensils in a town in Benin for five years. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin and sometimes in Lomé.

Seeking to satisfy her customers and increase her sales and her income, Pélagie, along with the other members of the Houenoussou Group, is seeking a second loan from Alidé. The loan will allow them to build up their business and turn a larger profit. The first loan has been repaid.

loans.use: To purchase kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Seflimi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SEFLIMI est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Valérie Akouavi est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Valérie Akouavi est âgée de 34 ans et vit au Bénin. Valérie Akouavi a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Valérie Akouavi est mariée à un certain du nom de Jacques. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Valérie Akouavi vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure avec son mari les diverses charges de la maison. Afin d'assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Valérie Akouavi vend depuis neuf ans de plastiques et des tissus par le système de distribution. Valérie Akouavi s’approvisionne dans un marché su Benin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Valérie Akouavi sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SEFLIMI, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The Seflimi Group is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, named Valérie Akouavi, is the woman with her hand raised in the photo.

Valérie Akouavi is 34 years old and lives in Benin. She left school during high school. Valérie Akouavi is married to a man named Jacques. The couple has three children, all of them enrolled in school and under their care. Valérie Akouavi lives with her husband and children and, with her husband, sees to the various household expenses.

In order to take care of the various family expenses, Valérie Akouavi has been selling plastic items and fabrics for nine years, using a distribution system. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin.

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and her income, Valérie Akouavi, along with the other members of the Seflimi Group, is seeking her first loan from Alidé.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and plastic items.

loans.name: Yelian Group

texts.fr: YELIAN est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Aulande (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 28 ans. Aulande est mariée à un certain Prosper. Le couple a un enfant qui est scolarisé et à leur charge. Aulande vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant et assure avec son mari les charges de la maison. Pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, Aulande mène comme activité principale la coiffure. De façon secondaire, Aulande vend des mèches et des produits cosmétiques depuis près de cinq ans dans une ville du Benin. Aulande s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. C’est la quatrième fois que Aulande et les autres membres du groupe YELIAN sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les crédits consentis antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Yelian is a group made up of three people, the members of which live in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, Aulande (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 28 years old.

Aulande is married to a man named Prosper. The couple has one child, who is enrolled in school and under their care. Aulande lives with her husband and child and, with her husband, sees to the household expenses.

In order to meet the needs of her family, Aulande's primary business is hair-dressing. Additionally, Aulande has been selling hair extensions and beauty products in a town in Benin for nearly five years. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin.

This is the fourth time that Aulande and the other members of the Yelian Group have sought the financial support of Alidé in order to strengthen their working capital and better respond to customer demand. The previously granted loans have been repaid.

loans.use: To purchase hair extensions and beauty products.

loans.name: Gbedokpo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBEDOKPO est formé de trois personnes qui habitent le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Rosalie, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Rosalie est âgée 27 ans et est mariée à un menuisier du nom de Norbert. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Rosalie vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure avec son mari les charges de la maison. Il y a près d’une dizaine d’année que Rosalie mène comme activité la vente de chips de bananes de façon ambulante. Rosalie s’approvisionne dans une ville du Benin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Rosalie désire obtenir un deuxième crédit, ensemble avec ses autres membres du groupe GBEDOKPO. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The Gbedokpo Group is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of this group, named Rosalie, is the woman whose hand is raised in the photo. This is the second time that this group is seeking Alidé's financial support in order to increase their business.

Rosalie is 27 years old and is married to a carpenter named Norbert. The couple has three children, all of them enrolled in school and under their care. Rosalie lives with her children and her husband and, with her husband, sees to the household expenses.

It has been nearly a decade since Rosalie began her mobile business selling banana chips. She gets her supplies from a town in Benin.

With the goal of strengthening her business and better responding to customer demand, Rosalie, along with the other members of the Gbedokpo Group, would like to secure a second loan. The first loan has been repaid.

loans.use: To purchase bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has seven children, and six of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, rent and school fees.

She sells second-hand clothes at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works six days a week. 

Alice has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bales of second-hand clothes. Her major business challenges are seasonality and the ever increasing prices of used clothes. 

Her goals are to start selling second-hand bags and also to educate her children up to university.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has six children, and all her children are in school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

Deborah sells second-hand clothes at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last 13 years. She works six days a week. 

Deborah has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. Her major business challenges are price fluctuations of clothes and transportation. 

Her aspirations are to build commercial houses and become a wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Agatha lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has two children, all of whom is in school. She also takes care of additional family members (father).

Agatha has a business of a retail shop. She has been in this business for less than one year, and she works 7 days out of every week. Agatha sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. Agatha has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and cooking oil. The main business challenges for Agatha include seasonality and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling on wholesale only and to build her own house shop. 

Agatha lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent, and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 2 children, none of whom are in school.  She also takes care of an additional family member (niece). 

Patricia has a retail shop business.  She has been in this business for 6 years and she works 7 days out of every week.  She sells her products in the shop by means of retail.  

Patricia has requested a loan of 500000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil. She also generates additional income through room rentals.

The main business challenges for Patricia include seasonality and thieves.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only and to own a fully-stocked shop.  

Patricia lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: buy sugar, salt, soap and cooking oil

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a fifty-five-year-old married woman with eight children aged between twelve and thirty-one. She describes herself as a principled woman. She operates a retail shop and for the past seven years has sold home product such as rice, milk, bread, sugar and cooking fat to local residents in a strategic area. She faces a challenge of insufficient capital and has therefore applied for a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase more stocks of rice, bread, and cooking fat. She sees her business expanding and opening job opportunities in the next five years.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of sugar, rice, bread, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en: Jeniffer is a married woman. She has 2 children between 19 and 24 years of age. She describes herself as an ambitious woman. She operates a retail stall where she sells plastic such as plates, buckets, basins, utencil holders etc. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located at a market area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of plastic. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more plastics to sell. Jeniffer's dream and business goal is to expand her retail stall within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more plastics for selling.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis, 35 years old, is married and has a 1-year-old daughter. He describes himself as a self-aggressive man. He operates a retail store where he provides tailoring services, making and selling dresses and repairing worn out clothes. He has been involved in this business for 1 year and employs 1 staff member. His business is located in a densely populated area and his primary customers are local residents. Francis describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of plastic. He will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy another sewing machine. Francis' business goal is to run a dressmaking school within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy another sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more vegetables.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 3 children, two of whom are in school. She doesn't take care of additional family members. Florence has a business of selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week.  Florence sells her products at the market, by means of retail. Florence has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal.  She also generates additional income through selling firewood and a restaurant. The main business challenges for Florence include the rainy season and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start going to villages of Luwero district for charcoal and to become a wholesaler only. Florence lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal for sale

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has four children, three of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (two orphans)

Betty has a business, selling bananas retail at the market.  She has been in this business for eight years, and she works seven days out of every week.  Betty has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of green bananas (plantains).  She also generates additional income through rental houses. The main business challenges for Betty include transportation and the rainy season, which hinders her customers’ ability to reach her at the market.

Her goals and aspirations are to educate her children through university and to become a wholesaler.  Betty lives in a home that she owns and she has access to both electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more food stuffs for preparing meals for selling.

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en:
Gorret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members. 

Gorret has a business of selling tea and chips. She has been in this business for three years, and she works seven days out of every week. Gorret sells her products at the market, by means of retail.

Gorret has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of Irish potatoes and cooking oil. She also generates additional income through rental houses. The main business challenges for Gorret include transportation and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery vehicle to ease in transportation and to become a wholesaler only. Gorret lives in a home that she owns; she has access to both electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of Irish potatoes and cooking oil.

loans.name: Dama

texts.en: Dama is a married woman. She has one child. Her husband's name is Kalama and he works as a casual worker. Dama operates selling food and sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for six months. Her primary customers are the general public. Dama's other source of income includes her husband's income. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Dama will use the KES 20,000 loan to start a vegetable kiosk and purchase sacks of vegetables, tomatoes, and potatoes. Dama aspires to be a wholesaler in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to start a vegetable kiosk and purchase sacks of vegetables, tomatoes, and potatoes

loans.name: Selina

texts.en: Selina is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 45,000 to boost her clothes selling business. With the loan, she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. The previous loan helped her change her family living standards and her children are attending school. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing a cereals shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Nzito

texts.en: Nzito is a 50-year-old married woman. She has 5 children all of whom are employed. Her husband's name is Rama and he works as a fishmonger. Nzito sells coconuts from home. She's worked in this business for three years. Her primary customers are villagers. Nzito's other source of income includes her children's income. She describes her greatest business challenge to be change in market prices and her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Nzito will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy 1000 coconuts for sale. Nzito aspires to open a depot in the future. She joined Yehu because of availability of various products.

loans.use: to buy 1000 coconuts for sale.

loans.name: Mangale

texts.en: Mangale is a 58-year-old married man. He has 3 children between the ages of 18 and 25 and 1 are enrolled in school. His wife's name is Mjeni. Mangale operates a grocery shop and sells his goods from home. He's worked in this business for 1 year. His major customers are neighbours and town dwellers. Mangale's other source of income includes working as cook in a nearby hotel and his highest monthly expense is food and high cost of transportation. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Mangale will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase sacks of tomatoes and potatoes. Mangale aspires to establish a business of selling clothes in the future. He joined Yehu to access funds to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes and potatoes.

loans.name: Mwanahawa

texts.en:
Mwanahawa is a 35-year-old married woman. She has six children. Her husband's name is Hassan; he works as a bodaboda. Mwanahawa operates a motorcycle transport business. She's worked in this business for one year. Her primary customers are villagers. 
Mwanahawa's other source of income is her retail shop business, where she sell household consumptions like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. Her greatest business challenge is high cost of transportation and her highest monthly expense is school fees. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Mwanahawa will use the Kes 30,000 loan to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sacks of sugar for her retail shop. Mwanahawa aspires to open a shop in the future. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sacks of sugar for her retail shop.

loans.name: Mwaulu

texts.en:
Mwaulu is a 35-year-old married woman. She has six children and all are enrolled in school. Her husband works as a fisherman. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Mwaulu operates a retail shop business and sells her goods in a shop. She has worked in this business for six years. Her primary customers are local residents. She describes her greatest business challenge as seasonality and her highest monthly expense is school fees.  

Mwaulu will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy wheat flour bundles, sugar and cooking fat. Mwaulu aspires to open a new shop in the future. She joined Yehu because of flexible and affordable policies to customer needs.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour bundles, sugar and cooking fat.

loans.name: Penninah

texts.en:
Penninah is a 41-year-old married woman. She has 3 children between the ages of 5 and 21 and 2 are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Paul and he works as a carpenter. 

Penninah operates a poultry business and sells her goods from home. Penninah also earns her other source of income from her business of operating taxi in town. She's worked in this business for 3 years. Her primary customers are neighbours and passersby. She describes her greatest business challenge to be the high cost of transportation. She owns a house that has both electricity and piped water. 

Penninah will use the KES 40000 loan to purchase chicks and chicken feeds. Penninah aspires to expand her chicken house in the future. She joined Yehu to improve her living standards.

loans.use: buy chicks and chicken feeds

loans.name: Mgandi

texts.en:
Mgandi is a married man with 4 children, 2 of whom are enrolled in school. His wife's name is Kanze, and she works as a farmer. Mgandi operates a business of keeping goats to sell for meat at the market. He has worked in this business for 8 years and was previously employed as a farmer. He also sells cereals. His primary customers are his community and butcher shop operators. 

He describes his greatest business challenge as drought and his highest monthly expenses as food, fees and hospital bills. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Mgandi will use the loan of 49,500 KES to buy more goats to sell for meat. Mgandi aspires to expand his business and open a slaughter house in the future. He joined Yehu, because it was changing people's lives.

loans.use: to buy more goats to sell for meat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Mwakaja

texts.en:
Mwakaja is a 33-year-old married woman. She has one child who is enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Karani and he works as a fishmonger. 

Mwakaja operates a teaching school, where she teaches kindergarten kids. She has worked in this business for three years. Her primary customers are students. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Mwakaja will use the KES 10,000 loan to purchase school teaching materials. She joined Yehu because of its favorable loan products and policies.

loans.use: to purchase school teaching materials.

loans.name: Gome

texts.en:
Gome is a 50-year-old married woman with four children, two of whom are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Mwanjole and he works as a farmer. For the past year, Gome has operated a wholesale cereal shop. Her primary customers are retail shop operators and community members. In addition she also sells charcoal as wholesale which contributes to her other source of income. Gome describes her greatest business challenge as seasonality and her largest monthly expenses are food, hospital bills, and school fees. She owns a house without electricity or running water. Gome joined Yehu to access capital to improve her business.

Gome is requesting a 45,000 KES loan to buy sacks of maize and sacks of charcoal for resale. In the future, she hopes to expand and have a permanent business location.

loans.use: to buy maize and sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Omari

texts.en:
Omari is a married man. He has 8 children and 5 are enrolled in school. His wife's name is Mwanamkasi and she is a businesswoman. Omari operates a bodaboda(motorcycle) from home to the market. He's worked in this business for 4 years. His primary customers are villagers. Omari's other source of income includes sales of milk. He describes his greatest business challenge to be price fluctuations and his highest monthly expense is food. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Omari will use the Kes 30,000 loan to purchase spare parts to service his motorcycle. Omari aspires to open a milk depot in the future. He joined Yehu because of its good public relations.

loans.use: buy spare parts for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Furaha

texts.en:
Furaha is a 32-year-old married man with five children, three of whom are enrolled in school. His wife's name is Mariam and she works as a milk vendor. For the past 14 years, Furaha has operated a cafe kiosk and also sells goods in a shop. His primary customers are passersby and students. Furaha's other source of income includes milk sales. He describes his greatest business challenge to be seasonality and his greatest monthly expense is school fees. Furaha owns a house without electricity and running water. He joined Yehu to access capital to expand his business.

Furaha is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to purchase more stock  of sugar, wheat flour, and rice. In the future, he aspires to own a big restaurant.

loans.use: to purchasesugar, wheat flour, and rice.

loans.name: Raquel Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Raquel, es de Masaya, comerciante  tiene la edad de 28 años, su negocio consiste en la elaboración de zapatos para  dama, tiene siete años de experiencia, empezó a los 21 años de edad desde muy joven por herencia de su mama, ella  es madre soltera  esta a cargo de su hijo. Comenta que también quiere salir adelante profesionalmente por lo que esta continuando sus estudios gracias al buen resultado que esta teniendo en su negocio.  Por lo que cuando ella no esta la mama le ayuda en el negocio a comercializarlo.
Sus puntos de ventas los tienen en Masaya, Ocotal, Managua, y también lo comercializa en el País de san Salvador. Comenta que tiene muchos clientes por lo que tiene que hacer varios pedidos. Actualmente esta necesitando invertirle más a su negocio, se acerca a Ceprodel para solicitar un nuevo préstamo para la compra de  esponja, vaqueta, tela, pega blanca y amarilla, suela, suavitel, cuña, bontex, azulón, hilo, cuero, remache, argolla, evilla y cuadrante. Dé esa manera poder satisfacer la demanda.
texts.en:
Raquel is from Masaya and a 28-year old merchant.  Her business consists of making women’s shoes.  She has seven years of experience, starting from when she was very young, 21 years old, having inherited the trade from her mother.  She is a single mother caring for her son.  She comments that she also wants to get ahead professionally, which is why she is continuing her studies thanks to the good results she is having with her business.  When she is not there, her mother helps her tend to the business.

Her points of sale are located in Masaya, Ocotal, Managua, and she also sells in the country of El Salvador.  She tells us she has many customers, which is why she has to place several orders.  She currently needs to invest further into her enterprise and approaches Ceprodel to request a new loan to buy sponges, buckets, fabric, white and yellow glue, soles, fabric softener, wedges, Bontex paper, dark blue canvas, thread, leather, rivets, rings, buckles and quarters.  In this manner, she will be able to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy sponges, buckets, fabric, white and yellow glue, soles, fabric softener, wedges, Bontex paper, dark blue canvas, thread, leather, rivets, rings, buckles and quarters.

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es: Don Isidro, reside en el departamento de Masaya, soltero, el ha salido adelante su negocio consistes en comercializar de forma  ambulante productos de la Avon y aparte que en su casa vende refresco desde hace 16 años de experiencia, comenta que el ya tiene sus clientes fijos,  trata de brindar el mejor servicio posible  de tal manera que queden satisfecho con el producto que el les ofrece. Quiere incrementar su inventario para aumentar sus  ventas  ya que tiene  mucha demanda. Por lo que se presenta a ceprodel a solicitar un crédito para la compra de  frijol, azúcar, gaseosas, productos Avon, frutas  para la elaboración de refrescos naturales. Y poder invertir más en su negocio. De esta manera el se estaría ayudando mucho a salir a delante podrá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Isidro lives in the department of Masaya and is single.  He has gotten ahead through his business, which consists of selling Avon products door-to-door.  He also sells beverages from his home, and has 16 years of experience.  He comments that he has steady customers and tries to provide the best service possible so they will be satisfied with the product he offers them.  

He wants to increase his inventory in order to augment his sales, as he has a great deal of demand.  For this reason, he approaches Ceprodel to request a loan to buy beans, sugar, sodas, Avon products, fruits to make his natural refreshments and to invest more in his business.  This would help him get ahead and be able to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, sodas, fruits to make his natural refreshments, and Avon products.

loans.name: Dora Elisa

texts.es:
Dora es una mujer de estado civil separada, con un hijo menor de 15 años de edad. Su domicilio esta ubicado en el distrito de Olmos, el cual cuenta con servicio de agua y luz.
La actividad que realiza Dora es la comercialización de ropa en su domicilio y en las zonas aledañas, trayendo mercadería de Lima y comprando aquí camisas y pantalones en la época escolar. Es muy conocida en la zona y tiene clientela fija.
El monto del préstamo es de 3000 nuevos soles, que serán empleados para el transporte de mercadería desde Lima hasta Chiclayo para comercializarla en las zonas aledañas a su hogar. 
Dora ha logrado con su trabajo e inversiones mejorar su calidad de vida, costeando los estudios de su hijo y la construcción de su nueva casa.
texts.en:
Dora is a woman whose marital status is separated, and she has a child who is 15 years old.  Her home is located in the Olmos district, which counts on water and electrical services.  

The activity that Dora realizes is the sale of clothing from her home and in the surrounding zones.  She brings her merchandise from Lima, where she buys shirts and pants for the school year.  She is very well known in her area, and has a steady customer base.

The amount of the loan is for 3000 Peruvian soles, which she will use to transport merchandise from Lima to Chiclayo to sell in the areas around her home.  

Through her work and investments, Dora has managed to improve her standard of living and finance the education of her son and the construction of her new house.

loans.use: to buy and sell clothing.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es:
Genoveva es una mujer de 40 años de edad, casada y tiene 2 hijas. Vive en casa propia con su familia. Dicho domicilio está ubicado en Caserío Cruce de Vega, en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande. Dicha casa cuenta con servicio de luz.
La actividad que realiza la titular es la crianza de ganado menor (ovino) y aves de corral, las cuales una vez alcanzado su tamaño y peso ideal, las comercializa en el mercado local. Su esposo es pescador de lunes a viernes y los fines de semana llega al domicilio.
El monto del crédito solicitado es de 1400 nuevos soles, los cuales se destinarán a la implementación de un dormitorio más en el domicilio en el que residen.
texts.en: Genoveva is a 40-year old woman, married, and has 2 daughters.  She lives in her own house with her family.  Said home is located in the hamlet of Cruce de Vega, in the rural zone of the district of Tambogrande.  Her house has electrical service.  The activity that she carries out is the raising of small livestock (sheep) and fowl that, once they reach their ideal size and weight, she sells at the local market.  Her husband is a fisherman from Monday to Friday, returning to the household on the weekends.  The amount of the loan requested is 1400 Peruvian soles, which will be destined for the implementation of another bedroom in the house where they live.

loans.use: to implement an additional bedroom for her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy livestock to expand his business.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en: Elenita is married with three children. She is 42 years old and lives in Paiton, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. To earn a living, she has a buy-and-sell cattle and goats business. She has had this business for ten years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 10,000. She has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to improve her living conditions by using the profits from the business.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is married with one child. She is 30 years old and lives in Malobog, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She sells pork barbeque to earn a living and has had this business for 6 months. Each month, she earns about PHP 1,000 doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy pork for making barbeque. She became a member of PMPC this year.  In the future, she hopes to improve her living conditions by using the profits from her business.

loans.use: to buy pork for making barbeque.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is married with two children. She is 31 years old and lives in Migcanaway, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She sells groceries to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns about PHP 6,000 doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy groceries to sell. She has been a member of PMPC for two years.  In the future, she hopes to improve her living conditions by using the profits from the business.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Eufimia

texts.en:
Eufimia is 44 years old and lives in Maquilao, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. She works in the fish industry and catches/sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 18 years. 

She has requested a loan to buy fishing supplies. She has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, she hopes to improve her living conditions by using profits from the business.

loans.use: to buy fishing supplies for her business.

loans.name: Batmunh

texts.en:
Batmunh is a 59-year-old man who lives with his wife and a daughter in Bayanhongor province in Southwestern Mongolia. His daughter studies at the college. He has operated a taxi business since 2010. Also, he has been running a retail meat business with his wife. They bring the supplies from the herders in neighboring villages and sell them from a well-positioned shop counter at the local trade center. This has been the only financial source for the family and has been successful. 

He has a further plan to expand the business activity by buying the meats wholesale from the herders. Batmunh is a good-natured man who says, "I would like to expand the business activity by buying the meat in large quantities." The total amount he is requesting is 500,000 MNT to buy meat for the business.

loans.use: To buy meat.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean, a 33-year-old married mother of two, works hard to provide for her family. For the past five years she has run a sari-sari store in the Philippines, and also earns an income from buying and selling piglets.

Mary Jean has borrowed and repaid two previous loans from NWTF and is now requesting a new one for PHP 10000 to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc. She aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Monica Pamela

texts.es:
Mónica es una mujer de 24 años de edad, soltera y sin hijos. Vive en el domicilio de su madre ubicado en el sector de La Matanza. Mónica tiene buenas referencias laborales y personales. En el sector donde vive habitan más de 10000 habitantes y ella vive en un pueblo joven.
La actividad que realiza consiste en la venta de útiles escolares, venta de uniformes y de bebidas gaseosas, negocio que ejerce hace 3 años en época de escolaridad, osea, de febrero a abril.
El monto solicitado en el préstamo asciende a 1008 nuevos soles, los cuales se emplearán en la compra de útiles y uniformes escolares, puesto que tiene que entregar pedidos que están pendientes. Se propicia una buena época para la venta de este tipo de artículos porque a inicios de año, la demanda aumenta y crece la cantidad de clientes.
texts.en:
Mónica is a 24-year-old woman. She is single and has no children. She lives in her mother's home in the La Mantanza sector. Mónica has good personal and work references. The population of the sector where she lives is over 10,000. She lives in a young village.
Mónica sells school supplies, uniforms, and pop. She has had this business for over three years and runs it during the school season; February to April.
She is requesting 1008 Nuevos Soles, which she will use to buy school supplies and uniforms; she has pending orders to fill. She expects a good sales season because demand increases at the beginning of the year and her number of customers increases.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Vicente Anastacio

texts.es:
Vicente es un hombre de 49 años de edad, casado y con 3 hijos. Vive en casa propia en el Caserío Punto Nueve, en la zona rural de Lambayeque. Cuenta con servicio de agua, la comunidad cuenta con aproximadamente 100 familias.
La actividad a la que se dedica es la comercialización de ganado ovino, ganado vacuno (vacas) y caprino dentro de su domicilio. Aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, de ahí se deduce que conoce a la perfección su rubro. Además, cuenta con ingresos adicionales producto de sus cultivos de arroz.
El monto del préstamo solicitado es de 2000 nuevos soles, destinados a la compra de úrea para el abono de sus cultivos de arroz recién transplantado y para la compra de una vaquillona que ha sido ofrecida en oferta. Este negocio cuenta con competencia pero con poco inventario.
texts.en:
Vicente is 49, married, and has three children. He lives in his own home in the Punto Nueve hamlet, in the rural Lambayeque zone. His home has running water, and there are approximately 100 families in his community.
Vincente sells sheep, cows and goats from his home. He learned this work from his parents; he knows this job like the back of his hand. Furthermore, he makes an additional income from his rice crops.
The requested 2000 Nuevos Soles will be used for the purchase of urea to fertilize his recently transplanted rice crops, and for the purchase of a heifer which is on sale. This is a strong business, but it has little inventory.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his crops and to buy livestock.

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en: Asuncion is a 49-year-old with 3 children who lives in Carangan, Ozamis City, Philippines. She has been sewing for 6 years and continues to do so. She designs dresses according to the customer's desired style, or sometimes she creates designs out of her own will and imagination. Every month, she earns 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP), which is enough to cover day-to-day expenses. Asuncion joined Gata Daku MPC earlier this year. She has applied for a loan of PHP 7,000 from the cooperative to buy sewing materials such as textiles and thread. By having all necessary materials, Asuncion hopes to create as much output as she can to generate more income. In the future, she plans to expand her business and/or buy another set of sewing machines.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials such as textiles and thread.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora works hard to support her family. She is married and has has a food vending business in the Philippines for the past three years.

Nora has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Reyna

texts.en:
Reyna is 24 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store (general store) in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like shampoo, groceries, and other items.

Reyna has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling gasoline.

Reyna aspires to save enough money to build a house for her family someday.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie is from Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old and married with three children. 

To make a living, Vergie runs a general store, selling a variety of food and household products in the local community. She has been in this business for 10 years and earns 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

Vergie is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This year, Vergie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and her living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 45 years old and married with 2 children. Milagros is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Milagros has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Milagros would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Las Preciosas Group

texts.es:
Olivia cuenta con 43 años de edad, es casada tiene 2 hijos los cuales están estudiando Juana de 16 años esta en segundo de preparatoria y Jonathan de 10 años esta cursando sexto de primaria, su esposo se llama Nicolás es campesino.

Ella es comerciante vende frutas y verduras en la central de el puerto de Acapulco ya tiene 9 años con el negocio, lo cual invertirá en la compra de verduras y frutas como son: papaya, limón, melón, sandia, etc. Ella dice que le va muy bien con el negocio espera y le vaya mejor esta vez ya que esta sacando adelante a su familia y quiere incrementar el negocio.

Olivia pertenece al grupo las preciosas el cual esta integrado por 5 personas las cuales todas son mujeres trabajadoras y comprometidas con el trabajo y a salir cada día adelante a continuación serán mencionadas: Olivia, Ma Guadalupe, Elisea, Maria Bernabé, Brenda, todas realizan una actividad comercial como son: ferretería, productos de abarrotes, frutas y verduras, vulcanizadota, etc
texts.en:
Olivia is 43, married, and has two children who are in school: Juana, age 16, is in the second year of preparatory school; Jonathan, age 10, is in the sixth grade of primary school. Olivia's husband Nicolás is a farmer.
Olivia is a merchant; she has sold fruits and vegetables in the Puerto de Acapulco for nine years. She will invest in the purchase of fruits and vegetables such as: papaya, lemon, melon, and watermelon. She says that the business is going very well and she hopes that it will improve with this loan. She is supporting her family and wants to expand her business.
Olivia belongs to the Las Preciosas group, which has five members, all hard-working women who are dedicated to their work and to getting ahead every day. These women are: Olivia, Ma Guadalupe, Elisea, Maria Bernabé, and Brenda. They each have a business such as: a hardware store; selling groceries; selling fruits and vegetables; a repair shop; etc.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables such as: papaya, lime, lemon, watermelon, etc.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 54 years old and married with 3 children. She runs a sari-sari store (general store) in the Philippines, and she works hard to provide for her family. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, and other items.

Teresita has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Teresita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Virginia works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from buying and selling ice and juice. Virginia is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle transport business.

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her prior 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for her motorcycle

loans.name: Bayarsaikhan

texts.en:
Bayarsaikhan is 34 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a ger (Mongolian yurt/nomadic tent) in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife changed her job and now works as a cook in a cafeteria while their two kids attend kindergarten. 

Since 2002, Bayarsaikhan has been running a taxi to support his family. He was trained as an engineer, but he still has not been able to find employment in his field. His business has been a main income source for his family for the past few years, as he explains. His wife’s monthly wage is not enough to provide the family's necessities. His car needs repair or renovation as soon as possible in order to continue his normal business operates. Core parts have been damaged, including an old engine and gear box, and its body is dated. Therefore he is requesting 1,200,000 MNT to purchase better spare parts and to cover his car renovation costs.

loans.use: To purchase better spare parts and to pay for the costs of renovating his car.

loans.name: Carlos Emilio

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre de 69 años de edad, es casado y no tiene hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa propia ubicada en el caserío Monteverde Bajo en el distrito de Tambogrande. Carlos vive en la zona rural, pero cuenta con servicio de electricidad.
La actividad a la que se dedica Carlos es la agricultura, para lo cual cuenta con 1.20 has de terreno agrícola, de los cuales 1.0 ha está sembrada de mango Kent en producción y también cuenta con plantas de limón y cacao. Complementariamente se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino, el cual al alcanzar tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa en el mercado local de su zona.
El destino del préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles es la realización de labores culturales en sus sembríos de mango, tales como poda, deshierbas y abonamiento. Carlos es un cliente conocido para la Edpyme Alternativa, ya que cumple puntualmente sus pagos y ya ha hecho préstamos a la entidad.
texts.en:
Carlos, age 69, is married and does not have any children under his care.  He lives in his own house in the Monteverde Bajo settlement in the Tambogrande district.  Carlos lives in a rural zone, but he does have electrical service.

Carlos is a famer.  He has 1.2 hectares of farmland.  He is growing Kent mangos on one of the hectares.  He also has lemon and cacao plants.  He also raises sheep.  When they reach the ideal size and weight he sells them at the local market in his zone.

He will use the 2,000 soles loan for agricultural work such as pruning, weeding, and fertilizing his mango crop.

Carlos is a known client of Edpyme Alternativa, has had loans with the organization, and has made his payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and agricultural chemicals.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 37 years old and married with 3 children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Vivian is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for 2 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 51 years old and married with four children. She runs a general store in the Philippines and works hard to provide for her family. 

Yolanda has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of merchandise to sell. Yolanda has borrowed and paid two previous loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for 20 years and earns additional income from a restaurant.

Yolanda aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of merchandise to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to sell bedspreads, curtains, and blankets through a catalogue.

loans.name: Anita

texts.es:
Anita es una mujer de 63 años de edad, es viuda y vive en casa propia. Vive en el caserío Cachinche, el cual está en el distrito de Mochumí. La mayoría de los pobladores de este caserío realizan venta de animales.
La actividad que realiza Anita es la venta de animales, la cual realiza en su domicilio y ya cuenta con clientela fija, además del servicio de costura, teniendo ya 3 años de experiencia. Adicionalmente se dedica a la agricultura. 
El monto del crédito es de 3000 nuevos soles, el cual se empleará para la compra de más animales, los cuales serán comercializados luego, además de alimentos para ellos y para el mantenimiento de su máquina de coser.
texts.en:
Anita is a 63 year old widow, and she lives in her own house.  She lives in the Cachinche settlement, which is in the Mochumí district.  Most of the inhabitants of this settlement sell animals.

Anita’s business activity is selling animals, which she does at home.  She has a fixed clientele.  She also provides sewing services, and she has three years of experience.  Additionally, she farms.

The amount of the loan is 3,000 soles.  She will use it to buy more animals, which will later be sold.  She will also buy animal feed and pay for maintenance on her sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy livestock for her business.

loans.name: Anamie

texts.en:
Anamie is 47 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Anamie works very hard to provide for them. She runs a spice retail business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as onions, garlic, spring onions, and other items.

Anamie has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of spices to sell. In the future, Anamie would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of spices to sell

loans.name: Evalyn

texts.en:
Evalyn is 25 years old and single. She works very hard to earn a living.

Evalyn runs a sari-sari store (general store) in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, toothpaste, canned goods, eggs, and biscuits. 

Evalyn has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, groceries, and other items. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is from Puntod Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old and married with 3 children. To earn a living, she sells fresh fish while her husband catches fish. She has been in this business for 7 years and earns 1,500 PHP a month. 

In 2008, Alejandra joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Alejandra is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to repair their fishing boat. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement the daily needs of her family.

loans.use: to repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is from Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental Province. She is 43 years old and married with four children. To make a living, Nenita owns and operates a fishing business. She has been engaged in her business for 12 years and earns 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Nenita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Nenita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to buy another fish net. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy another fish net

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is from Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental Province. She is 30 years old and married. To make a living, Carmen owns and operates a fishing business. She has been engaged in her business for 5 years and earns 1,000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2008, Carmen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Carmen is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to repair her fishing boat. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement the needs of her family.

loans.use: to repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Entente Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ENTENTE est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Ayaba Germaine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Ayaba Germaine est âgée de 35 ans et vit au Bénin. Ayaba Germaine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Ayaba Germaine est veuve mais a un enfant scolarisé à sa charge. Ayaba Germaine vit seule avec son enfant et assure seule les diverses charges de la maison. Afin d'assurer ses diverses charges, Ayaba Germaine vend depuis trois ans, de tissus à travers le système de distribution. Ayaba Germaine s’approvisionne dans une ville du Benin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Ayaba Germaine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ENTENTE, un  crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The group ENTENTE consists of three friends. The group’s representative is Ayaba Germaine, seen with her hand raised in the photo. 

Ayaba Germaine is 35 years old and she lives in Bénin. She never went to school. She is a widow with one dependent child who attends school. She lives alone with her child and she handles the household responsibilities on her own. 

In order to deal with the various family expenses, Ayaba Germaine started selling fabrics through the distribution system three years ago. She buys her merchandise in a city of Benin. 

Eager to achieve customer satisfaction and to increase her sales and revenue,  Ayaba Germaine is seeking a loan from ALIDé together with the other members of the group ENTENTE.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es una mujer de 49 años de edad, es casada y cuenta con 4 hijos a su cargo. Vive en domicilio propio en el sector Valle de los Incas, en el distrito de Tambogrande. Vive en la zona rural del distrito, pero cuenta con servicio de luz eléctrica.
La actividad que desarrolla Carmen es la venta de comida y chicha, negocio ubicado en propio domicilio, atendiendo los días viernes, sábados, domingos y lunes contando con clientela conocida. Esta actividad la desarrolla hace más de 6 años. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, terreno propio, en el cual tiene sembrado mango y limón que cosecha y vende semanalmente, generándole ingresos extras para apoyar a su esposa en sus obligaciones crediticias y canasta familiar.
El monto del crédito solicitado es de 1200 nuevos soles, los cuales serán invertidos en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de chicha, tales como azúcar, maíz duro, así como para la compra de fertilizantes para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Carmen, age 49, is married and has four children under her care.  She lives in her own house in the Valle de los Incas sector of the Tambogrande district.  She lives in a rural area of the district, but she does have electrical service.

Carmen’s business activity is selling food and “chicha” (a corn based drink).  Her business is located in her own home.  She tends to her business on Fridays, Saturdays, Sundays, and Mondays with customers whom she knows.  She has been doing this for over six years.

Her husband is a farmer, and he has his own land. He grows mangos and lemons, which he harvests and sells weekly.  He is generating extra income to support his wife with the obligations of the loan and with providing the family with food.

She is requesting a loan for 1,200 soles to buy supplies to make chicha.  She will buy things like sugar, hard corn, and fertilizers for their crops.

loans.use: to buy things like sugar, hard corn, and fertilizers for the crops.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is a 37-year-old resident of Kinuman, Ozamis City. She provides her 3 children's needs from the little amount of 3,000 PHP she gains monthly from her own banana production business, which she has operated for 5 years as an aid to the income gained from her husband.

However, this year she joined GDMPC, and she applied for a loan of 5,000 PHP at GDMPC micro-finance to buy young crops and fertilizer. Elisa wants to make an expansion to her business one day.

loans.use: to buy young crops and fertilizer.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
