Her business goal is to own several such general stores within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Jeovanny Omar

texts.es:
Jeovany está solicitando un nuevo préstamo  para pagar con anticipación el alquiler del terreno donde se dispone a sembrar maíz y frijol de la temporada de invierno, con este préstamo lograra tener seguridad para empezar su trabajo agrícola.
Con el préstamo anterior el logro realizar la compra de los materiales necesarios para siembra, dándole la cosecha buena, manifiesta que este apoyo ha sido importante para mejorar su trabajo.
texts.en: Jeovany is requesting a new loan to pay in advance for the rent of the land where he plans to grow corn and winter beans, with this loan he will be able to secure the plan to start his agricultural work.  With the previous loan he was able to buy the necessary materials to grow crops, it gave him a good harvest and he mentions this support has been important to improve his work.

loans.use: to pay for the rent of his land

loans.name: Mario Ezequiel

texts.es:
Don Mario Ezequiel es originario del municipio de Achuapa donde ha vivido toda su vida, es un padre de familia responsable que ha preparado a todos sus hijos profesionalmente y que hoy son personas independientes y de bien.
En la actualidad solo depende de él su esposa con quien trabajan duramente día a día en su negocio el cual consiste en una Pulpería donde ofrecen todo tipo de abarrotería en general, es un negocio bien surtido y visitado por sus clientes por la variedad de productos y por la amabilidad de sus dueños.
Se acercó por primera vez a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, jabón, golosinas, gaseosas y verduras. con el objetivo de surtir más su inventario de productos brindando así un mayor grado de satisfacción a sus clientes, gracias a las utilidades que obtienen de este,  viven dignamente con todas las comodidades en su hogar.
Espera que esta Institución le apoye donde le estará muy agradecido.
texts.en:
Don Mario Ezequiel is a native of the municipality of Achuapa, where he has lived all his life. He is the responsible father of a family who has prepared all his children for careers, and today they are good, independent people.

Now the only one who depends on him is his wife, with whom he works hard day after day in their business, which consists of a grocery store where they offer all types of groceries in general. It is a well-stocked business that is visited by their customers because of the variety of its products and the friendllness of its owners.

He approached Ceprodel for the first time to apply for a loan to buy rice, sugar, oil, soap, candies, soft drinks and vegetables, with the objective of increasing his inventory of products, thus offering his customers a higher level of satisfaction. Thanks to the earnings that they obtain, they live with dignity in a home with all the conveniences.

He hopes that this institution will help him, for which he will be very grateful.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, soap, candies, soft drinks, and vegetables for his store

loans.name: Beatriz Elena

texts.es: Beatriz de 57 años de edad vive con su cónyuge y tiene un hijo en la edad de 31 años y de profesión abogado. Muy cerca al mar habita y tienen su negocio de miscelánea, donde vende calzado, bolsos,  accesorios femeninos y en general mucha variedad de productos. Su experiencia de negocio la inició desde hace 16 años y ha logrado sostenerla, con su disciplina de trabajo, variedad en sus productos y atención especial a su clientela. Su meta es ampliarla aun más, hasta convertirla en un gran almacén. Ella está muy feliz de tener su miscelánea, pues no tienen que rendirle cuentas a un jefe, a ella le satisface atender a sus clientes que en su mayoría son sus vecinos y amigos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará mercancía especial para el día de las madres, como vestidos, calzado, perfumes, colonias, cremas. El éxito de su inversión radica en su experiencia, en que tiene una clientela fiel y además en que se ajusta a la temporada como el día de las madres, época en la cual tradicionalmente hace su mejor venta
texts.en: Beatriz is 57 and lives with her husband.  She has one son who is 31 and is a lawyer.  She lives very close to the ocean and has a general store where she sells shoes, bags, women's accessories, and in general a large variety of products.  She started her business 16 years ago and has managed to sustain it with her work ethic, variety of products, and customer servce.  Her goal is to expand her store even more until it becomes a large department store.  She is very happy about having her store.  She is her own boss, and it satisfies her to attend to her clients, the majority of whom are her friends and neighbors.  Currently she is applying for a Kiva loan.  This is the first financing she has had from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy special merchandise for Mother's Day, like dresses, shoes, perfumes, colognes, and creams.  The success of her investment lies in her experience.  She has a loyal clientele and she also adjusts to the season like for Mother's Day, a time where traditionally she has her best sales.

loans.use: to buy special merchandise for Mother's Day, like dresses, shoes, perfumes, colognes, and creams.

loans.name: Gavina Teresa

texts.es: Gavina es socia del Banco Comunal Agua Viva, tiene 46 años, es madre de 4 hijos, es casada, se dedica a la venta de cuyes y a la crianza de ovejas, vende salchipollo, ella esta muy agradecida a Finca porque le ayudaron a tener una buena formación para mantener un buen negocio. Ahora el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en alimento para engordar a las ovejas y la otra mitad para comprar papa y pollo.
texts.en: Gavina is a member of the Agua Viva (Living Water), she is 46 years old, she is married and she has 4 children. She breeds sheep and she sells cuyes (“cuy” is Quechua for Guinea pig) and salchipollo (fried potatoes served with fried chicken and sauces). She is deeply grateful to Finca because of the good training they have given her, helping her running a good activity. She will use half of the loan she is currently requesting to buy animal feed to fatten her sheep, and the other half to buy potatoes and chicken.

loans.use: To buy animal feed, potatoes and chicken.

loans.name: Neria

texts.en:
Neria is 42 years old and married with eight children. With five children in school, Neria works very hard to provide for them.

Neria runs a nipa business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.  Nipa are woven palm mats used for house construction and repair.

Neria has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future Neria would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Teófila

texts.es: Teófila es socia del Banco Comunal Agua Viva, tiene 55 años, es madre de 8 hijos, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 14 años, se dedica a la venta de flores y cereales, Finca le pudo ayudar en al educación  de sus hijos, esta muy agradecida por las capacitaciones que le dan le ayudan a poder tener una noción de como llevar un negocio. Ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de flores.
texts.en: Teófila is a member of the Agua Viva (Living Water), she is 55 years old and she has 8 children. She sells flowers and cereals, and she has been a member of Finca Peru for 14 years, and Finca has been able to help her with the education of her children. She is very grateful for the seminars she attends, as they help her getting ideas about how to run her activity. The loan she is currently requesting will be used to buy more flowers.

loans.use: To buy flowers.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Amor y Esperanza, tiene 63 años, se dedica la venta de pescado, es madre de 3 hijos, ella estaba en Finca hace 8 años atrás pero tuvo un problema y se retiro, durante ese corto tiempo trato de hacer las cosas como en Finca le habían enseñado, y ahora volvió y ya esta nuevamente en Finca 3 años, esta muy contenta de haber regresado porque le gusta ahorrar y las capacitaciones que son muy útiles para ella. Ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en al compra de pescado.
texts.en: Maria, 63, is a member of the Amor y Esperanza (Love and  Hope) communal bank.  She has 3 children and her business is selling fish.  She was in the Foundation 8 years ago but she had a problem and had to pull out.  During this short period she tried to do the work as Finca had taught her, and she has again joined and has been with Finca for 3 years.  She is very happy that she has returned because she likes to save, and the trainings are very useful for her.  She will use the loan to buy fish.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Mileydis

texts.es: Mileydis  de 24 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y su hijo de 3 años al sur de la ciudad, donde se dedica a la venta de mercancías que promociona mediante guías especializada de productos y también tiene un punto comercial donde vende útiles escolares y papelería en general. Su negocio inició por la necesidad de generar ingresos adicionales para fortalecer el bienestar de su hogar; fue así como con   ahorros que había hecho desde muy niña, compró su primera vitrina y la surtió. Hoy su clientela se ha extendido y está muy entusiasmada por hacerlo crecer, pero su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para lograr aumentar el volumen de compras de contado, ganar descuentos y ofrecer una mayor variedad de mercancías. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará útiles de papelería, aprovechando que en el sector donde está ubicada no tiene competencia y esto es lo que justamente hace que su credikiva sea exitoso y cumpla con la misión de su negocio que no es otra que la de satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mileydis is 24, and lives south of the city with her partner and her 3-year-old son. She sells merchandise that she promotes through specialized product guides, and also has a shop where she sells stationery supplies and stationery in general. 

She started her business because she needed to generate additional income to improve her household's well-being. This is how, with her savings from the time she was very young, she bought her first display case and stocked it. Today her clientele has expanded, and she is very excited to see it grow. 

But her working capital is insufficient for her to manage to increase her volume purchases in cash, in order to earn discounts and offer a greater variety of merchandise. This why she is applying for her credikiva loan, her first from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. 

With the loan, she will buy stationery supplies, taking advantage of the fact that in area where she is located she has no competition. This is precisely what will make her investment succeed and fulfill her business's mission, which is none other than meeting the needs of her customers.

loans.use: To buy stationery supplies.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es:
Manuel de Jesús, reside en Masaya, tiene la edad de 39 años, su núcleo familiar es de tres,  él  trabaja  en una empresa que se encarga de comercializar productos de alimentos como carne de pollo, desde hace 14 años. 
Actualmente esta necesitando un crédito para realizar  mejoras en su vivienda la cual consiste en poner ladrillo en  toda la casa. Por lo que esta solicitando a Ceprodel un financiamiento para la compra de cemento, arena, arenilla, ladrillosa así poder realizar sus metas. Y poder dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Manuel de Jesús lives in Masaya. He is 39 years old. His nuclear familiar consists of three people. He has worked for 14 years in a business that markets food products such as chicken.

At this time he needs a loan to complete some home improvements, which consist of putting bricks on the whole house. For this reason he is applying to Ceprodel for a loan to purchase cement, sand, grit, and bricks to complete his objective and to be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, grit, and bricks

loans.name: Diomedes

texts.es: Diomedes de 32 años, vive con su cónyuge y su hijo de 10 años de edad al sur de la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde se dedica al comercio de víveres, ranchos, refrescos y productos de la canasta familiar, entre familias que habitan principalmente alrededor de su tienda.  Diomedes inició su negocio desde hace más de dos años en un local arrendado, porque su espíritu emprendedor, lo direccionaba hacia una actividad independiente en la que dejara de ser empleado y llegara a ser su propio jefe, como lo ha logrado en la actualidad, pues gradualmente ha ido comprando herramientas de trabajo, activos fijos, que hoy son de su propiedad. En su negocio vende diariamente y es atendido por él y su cónyuge, ambos tienen como meta futura, comprar el local donde están arrendados. Su mayor desafío es no tener el capital de trabajo suficiente,  para cumplir rápidamente sus propósitos, de inversión en los artículos de mayor rotación en la tienda y en mayor cantidad, y poder  disminuir la frecuencia de compras y ganar descuentos por compras en volúmenes, de contado, generando así una mayor   utilidad. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer finaciamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará víveres, ranchos, refrescos y bebidas, productos que vende muy rapidamente y con los que logrará su meta ya mencionada.
texts.en:
Diomedes is 32, and lives south of the city of Barranquilla with his partner and his 10-year-old son. There he has a business selling groceries, snacks, soft drinks, and household products, to families who live mainly around his store. 

Diomedes started his business more than two years ago in a rented locale, because his entrepreneurial spirit directed him toward an independent livelihood, where he could stop being an employee, and be his own boss--which he has now succeeded in doing, as gradually he has bought work equipment and fixed assets that now belong to him. 

He sells every day in his business, which he and his partner run. Both have as their future goal, to buy the shop they rent. Their greatest challenge is not having sufficient working capital to fulfill their objectives quickly. These are to invest in store items with the highest turnover, buying in greater quantity, and enabling them to decrease the frequency of their purchases and earn volume cash purchase discounts. In this way they can generate higher profits.

This is precisely the reason why he is applying for his credikiva loan, his first from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With the loan, he will buy groceries, snacks, soft drinks, and other drinks; products that sell very quickly and through which he will achieve the above-mentioned goal.

loans.use: To buy groceries, snacks, soft drinks, and other drinks.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis es socio del Banco Comunal Amor y Esperanza, tiene 52, es dueño de una Panadería, es padre de 3 hijos, es socio de Finca Perú desde hace 4 años, él aprendió mucho de como llevar bien su negocio y también pudo mejorar su relación familiar, él esta muy bien Finca porque le da capacitación, lo que otras entidades financieras no le dan, ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en al compra de harina.
texts.en: Luis, 52, has been a member of the Amor y Esperanza (Love and  Hope) communal bank four years.  He has 3 children and owns a bakery  He learned a lot about how to keep his business running well and also how to improve his family relationships.  He is doing well with Finca because of the trainings, something that the other financial institutions don’t offer.  He will use this loan to buy flour.

loans.use: to buy flour

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es: Emilia es socia del Banco Comunal Amor y Esperanza, tiene 53 años, es madre de 2 hijos, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 3 años, se dedica a la venta de carne, pescado y cachipa, ella esta muy agradecida por las cosas que pudo aprender que le ayudaron para poder tener una noción de cómo se debe llevar un negocio, ahora ella ha progresado mucho y desea poder seguir mejorando, pudo ayudar con la educación de sus hijos, ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de carne para poder llevar a la selva
texts.en: Emilia is a member of the communal bank, "Amor y Esperanza" [Love and Hope].  She is 52 and the mother of 2 children.  She has been a member of Finca Peru for 3 years.  She makes a living by selling meat, fish, and cachipa (artesanal cheese).  She is very thankful for the things she was able to learn that helped her to be able to have an idea like starting a business.  Now she has made a lot of progress, and she wants to be able to keep improving.  She was able to help with her children's education.  Now with this loan, she will invest in the purchase of meat to take to the jungle.

loans.use: to buy meat.

loans.name: Jose Adan

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos, la casa es familiar, él se dedica al destazo de res y siembra de maíz, desde hace 30 años siembra maíz y hace 10 que se está dedicando al destazo, con estas ocupaciones ha logrado salir a delante con su familia.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de insumos para la siembra como el abono, herbicidas, tambien comprara dos reces, esto le ayudara a mejorar la calidad de sus cosechas, y con las reces tendrá para el destazo.
La aspiración de José es tener un puesto propio y fijo con el negocio de la carne, porque le permitirá que sus clientes tengan acceso más fácilmente.
texts.en: José lives with his wife and three children.  He makes a living by butchering cattle and growing corn.  He has harvested corn for 30 years and has butchered for 10 years.  With these occupations, he has managed to get ahead with his family.  He is requesting a loan to buy supplies for planting like fertilizers and herbicides.  He will also buy two heads of cattle.  This with help him improve the quality of his harvests, and he will have the cattle to butcher.  José's aspiration is to have his own fixed location for his meat business because this will let his customers have easier access to it.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides, and two heads of cattle.

loans.name: Jose Jeremias

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa, por el momento no tienen hijos, él se dedica a la comercialización de ganado, realiza las compras y las ventas en el tiangue, tiene ya algunos clientes a quienes compra y vende.
El solicita un préstamo para la invertirlo en la compra de dos novillas, que se las están vendiendo y es un buen negocio, esto le dará a futuro una margen de ganancias que quiere aprovechar.
La aspiración de José es desarrollarse con su negocio, aportando más a su familia y un día crecer en ella junto a su esposa.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife. At the present time, they have no children. His work is selling livestock. He makes his purchases and sales in El Tiangue. He already has several customers to whom he sells and from whom he buys.

He is applying for a loan to invest in the purchase of two steers that are being sold and that will be a good deal. In the future this will give him a good profit margin, which he wants to take advantage of.

José's aspiration is to develop in his business, contribute more to his family, and someday, with his wife, make it larger.

loans.use: to buy two steers

loans.name: Emilse

texts.es: Emilce de 50 años tiene un taller de confecciones en el municipio de Puerto Colombia, muy cerca al mar donde vive con sus tres  hijas en las edades de 9, 16 y 21 años. Ella tiene un taller de confecciones desde cuando adquirió su primera máquina hace 20 años y empezó a confeccionar para sus amigas, vestidos, blusas y faldas. Gradualmente su mercado empezó a crecer y con ello las posibilidades de vender otros productos como calzado, colonias, ropa informal, para generar mas ingresos y generar bienestar a su hogar.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, segundo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización en la que tienen un año de estar vinculada y con la que ha logrado tener un capital de trabajo para atender nuevos pedidos y ganar un poco mas. Con su credikiva, comprará una nueva máquina de coser, porque necesita aumentar su productividad y mejorar la calidad de las prendas, teniendo en cuenta que quiere abordar mercados mas estructurados. Su meta mas adelante es ampliar su negocio, adecuando su infraestructura de máquinas y logrando la vinculación de operarias que apoyen sus procesos productivos y generen ingresos que las beneficien.
texts.en: Emilce, 50, has a dressmaking shop in Puerto Colombia, very close to the sea, where she lives with her three daughters, 9, 16 and 21.  She has had the shop since she got her first sewing machine 20 years ago and began to make dresses, blouses and skirts for her friends.  Gradually her market began to grow and with it, the possibility of selling other products such as shoes, perfumes, and casual clothing  to generate more income and help with the welfare of her household.  She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her second financing with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  She has been a member of this organization for a year and with it has succeeded in having working capital to cover new orders and to earn a little more.  She will use the Kiva loan to buy a new sewing machine because she needs to increase her productivity and to improve the quality of her clothing.  This is because she wants to get involved with more structured markets.  Her goal for the future is to expand her business,adaptaing her infrastructure of sewing machines and succeed with the incorporation of workers who help her production and are able to earn for themselves as well.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Carmen De Jesus

texts.es:
Carmen, es comerciante de ropa nueva, vive con su esposo, tiene hijos pero ya están fuera del hogar, su esposo es un militar, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, lo aprendió por la necesidad de tener una fuente de ingresos propia.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa nueva blusas, ropa interior, ropa de niños, para mantener surtido el negocio y seguir trabajando, este préstamo le ayudara a atender más clientes, así mismo a obtener mayores ingresos por sus ventas.
La aspiración de Carmen es tener un negocio más estable y permanente.
texts.en:
Carmen sells new clothes. She lives with her husband. She has children that are living independently. Her husband is in the military. She has a clothing sales business. She learned this business because she needed to generate her own income.
She is asking for this loan in order to buy new blouses, underwear and children’s clothes in order to have a variety of clothes in her business and to continue working. This loan will help her assist her customers. She will be able to get better earnings from her sales. Carmen’s aspiration is to have a more stable and permanent business.

loans.use: to buy new blouses, underwear and children's clothes.

loans.name: Rosa Edelmira

texts.es:
Rosa, se dedica a la venta de perfumería por catalogo, vive con su esposo y su hija, aprendió el negocio hace 5 años, comenzándolo por una amiga, quien le apoyo para iniciar, con esto ha logrado mantener ingresos para sus propias necesidades.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de artículos para la venta como lo es las lociones, cremas, accesorios, para surtir el negocio, ayudándole a mejorar la atención a la clientela y obtener mejores ingresos.
La aspiración de Rosa es poder a través de la rentabilidad del negocio, mejorar las instalaciones de su vivienda.
texts.en: Rosa makes a living by selling perfumes she orders from a catalog.  She lives with her husband and her daughter.  She learned this business 5 years ago and started it with a friend, who supported her at the beginning.  She has managed to maintain income for her own needs.  She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of articles to sell like lotions, creams, and accessories.  She will stock her business, which will help her improve her customer service and obtain better income.  Rosa's aspiration is to be able to improve her home through her business's profits.

loans.use: to buy lotions, creams, and accessories.

loans.name: Joel

texts.es:
Joel, vive con su esposa y tres hijos de 15, 17, 7 años de edad, todos dependen de él, Joel se dedica a la venta de medicinas, la distribuye en algunas zonas conocidas, donde ya tiene clientes, tambien en los lugares de trabajo.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de medicamentos para surtir el negocio, vitaminas, sueros, medicamentos curativos, entre otros que hoy en día existen para el alivio de muchas enfermedades.
La aspiración de Joel es mejorar el negocio, y ofrecer a su familia una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
Joel lives with his wife and three children, ages 15, 17 and 7. The children are dependent upon Joel. Joel sells medicines. He distributes them in familiar areas where he has customers. He also sells them in customer’s workplaces.
He is asking for this loan in order to buy medicines so that he can provide a variety of goods in his business. He will buy vitamins, electrolyte mixtures, and curative medicines among other medicines that now exist to alleviate illnesses. 
Joel’s aspiration is to improve his business and provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, electrolyte mixtures and curative medicines.

loans.name: Ana Arely

texts.es:
Ana, se dedica a la venta de camarones y pescado seco, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, es una mujer de hogar y mucho trabajo, manifiesta haber aprendido el negocio con su madre, luego instalo su propio negocio desde hace 6 años.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de más camarones y pescado seco, con la intensión de tener más disponibilidad de producto para ofrecer a la clientela y generar más ingresos.
El sueño de Ana es ampliarse con el negocio, agregar otros rubros para variar y mantener la preferencia de los clientes, tambien quiere ser más rentable y comenzar a construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Ana sells shrimp and dried fish. She lives with her husband and two children. She is a homemaker and works a lot. She states that she learned this business alongside her mother, then she set up her own business 6 years ago.

She is applying for a loan to purchase more shrimp and dried fish, with the intention of having more product available to offer to her customers and generate more income.

Ana's dream is to expand her business and add other products for variety and to keep the business of her customers. She also wants to be more profitable and begin to construct her own house.

loans.use: to buy shrimp and dried fish to sell

loans.name: Scarlette Isachara

texts.es: Scarlette Isachara ya es cliente de Fundación León 2000, durante sus créditos ha demostrado ser muy responsable y con deseos de superación en lo personal y en su negocio siempre abasteciéndose de productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes. Esta emprendedora está solicitando financiamiento para comprar más productos para el cafetín lo cual comprara con el crédito golosinas, pan, gaseosas, galletas, jugos y chocolates, tajadas, entre otros productos que sus clientes le demandan.
texts.en: Scarlette Isachara is a client of Fundación León 2000.  Through her loans, she has proven to be very responsible and has shown the desire to improve both personally and in her business.  She is always supplying herself with products to offer her customers.  She is enterprising and is requesting financing to buy more products for her cafe, like candy, bread, soft drinks, cookies, juices, chocolates, fried plantain slices and other products that her customers demand.

loans.use: to buy candy, bread, soft drinks, cookie, juice, chocolates fried plantain slices, and other products that her customers demand.

loans.name: Khusanjon

texts.ru: Хусанжон житель района Шахритус. Ему 35 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Он зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Кредит берет для закупа бычков.
texts.en: Khusanjon is a resident of the region of Shahrituz. He is 35 years old, married and has three children. He makes a living by breeding large horned cattle. He is taking out the loan to buy calves.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Nargiz

texts.ru: Наргиз проживает в городе Худжанд. Ей 32 года. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Ее муж работает в МБТИ. Сама Наргиз у себя дома занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Этим видом деятельности занимается 13 лет. Кредит берет для расширения своей деятельности, для приобретения еще одной швейной машинки.
texts.en: Nargiz lives in the town of Khujand. She is 32 years old, married and has four children. Her husband works in the MBTI. Nargiz sews national Tajik dresses at home. She has been in this business for thirteen years. She is taking out the loan to expand her business and buy one more sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Uktamjon

texts.ru: Уктамчон проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ему 40 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Уктамчон занимается торговлей. Он три года как открыл продуктовый магазин. Его жена помогает ему в торговле. Кроме того Уктамчон занимается растениеводством у себя дома. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 20 лет. Кредит берет для покупки масла, замороженных курочек и закупа семян овощей.
texts.en: Uktamjon lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. He is 40 years old, married and has two children. Uktamjon is in sales. He has opened his own grocery store three years ago. His wife helps him with sales. Besides that Uktamjon does plant cultivation at home. He has been in this business for twenty years. He is taking out the loan to buy oil, frozen hens and vegetable seeds.

loans.use: to buy oil, frozen hens and vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Noel

texts.es:
Noel, vive acompañado de su esposa y sus tres hijos de 4, 6, 11 años, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, lleva ya 15 años en este oficio, lo aprendió de su padre y lo trabaja todos los días de 6:00am a 3:00pm.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para el arrendamiento del terreno para la siembra de maíz y frijol, este préstamo le dará la seguridad de tener el terreno para iniciar su trabajo.
La aspiración de Noel es que a través de su esfuerzo en la agricultura, pueda apoyar a sus hijos para que se desarrollen y estudien.
texts.en:
Noel lives with his wife and his three children, ages 4, 6, and 11.  He works growing corn and beans.  He has been doing this work for 15 years.  He learned it from his father and he works every day from 6:00 a.m. until 3:00 p.m.

He is requesting a loan to rent land to plant corn and beans.  This loan will give him the security of having the land to begin his job.

Noel's goal is that through his effort in agriculture he can help his children to develop and study.

loans.use: to rent land.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (sister and brother).   

Juliet sells chips, door to door.  She has been in business for 5 years and works 6 days a week.  

Juliet has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, to buy more bags of Irish potatoes and cooking oil. 

Her main business challenges are defaulters and thieves.  Her goals and aspirations are to build her own home and to educate her children up to university level.  Juliet lives in a home that she rents.  It offers access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees

loans.use: to buy more bags of Irish potatoes and cooking oil.

loans.name: Florentin

texts.es:
Florentín, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y crianza de ganado, vive en compañía de su esposa y una hija de 26 años, él se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 20 años, trabajado todos los días desde las 6:00am hasta las 4:00pm.
Él solicita un préstamo para el pago de alquiler de dos manzanas de terreno, en el cual espera cultivar maíz y frijoles, tambien quiere comprarse dos terneros, con esto espera asegurar el lugar donde se dispone a sembrar y aumentar el ganado.
La aspiración de Florentín, es apoyar a su familia, con el esfuerzo de su trabajo y con este préstamo espera tener buenos resultados en sus cosechas.
texts.en:
Florentín grows corn and raises livestock.  He lives with his wife and a 26 year old daughter.  He has been devoting himself to this business activity for 20 years.  He works every day from 6:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m.

He is requesting a loan to pay the rent for two “manzanas” (a land measurement unit equivalent to 7000 square meters) of land.  He hopes to grow corn and beans on the land.  Also, he wants to buy two calves.  With this loan he hopes to be assured that he has an available place to plant and that he will increase his livestock.

Florentín’s goal is to support his family.  With the effort of his work and with this loan he hopes to have good results with his harvests.

loans.use: to pay the rent for two “manzanas” (a land measurement unit equivalent to 7000 square meters) of land.

loans.name: Mamurjon

texts.ru: Мамурчон проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ему 46 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Мамурчон занимается растениеводством. Он выращивает овощи и продает саженцы парниковых овощей (помидоров и огурцов). Этим видом деятельности он занимается 20 лет. Кредит берет для закупа семян помидоров и огурцов.
texts.en: Mamurjon lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. He is 46 years old, married and has three children. Mamurjon is in agriculture. He has been growing vegetables and selling seedlings of greenhouse vegetables (tomatoes and cucumbers). He has been in this business for twenty years. He is taking out the loan to buy tomato and cucumber seeds.

loans.use: to buy seeds of tomatoes and cucumbers.

loans.name: Abdugaffor

texts.ru: Абдугаффор проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ему 41 год. Он женат. У него трое детей. Абдугаффор откармливает и продает крупнорогатый скот. Этим видом деятельности занимается 15 лет. Кредит берет для закупа телят.
texts.en: Abdugaffor lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. He is 41 years old, married and has three children. Abdugaffor fattens and sells large horned cattle. He has been in this business for fifteen years. Abdugaffor is taking out the loan to buy calves.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a 43 year-old married woman with five children.  Her husband works as a driver.   

Josefina runs a sari-sari (convenience) store business in Trinidad, Bohol.  She sells various items like biscuits, eggs, canned goods and toiletries. Josefina wants to help provide for her family's needs and she is doing her best to do so.

Josefina is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell such as vinegar, soft drinks and canned goods.  Josefina hopes to uplift her family's quality of living.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as vinegar, soft drinks and canned goods.

loans.name: Aine

texts.en:
Aine is a 23 year old married woman with three children, ages five, seven, and eight.  She is from Bien Unido, 

Bohol and has been in the fishing business for seven years.  Her husband is a fisherman.  She requests a loan to buy fishing-related products, such as seaweed, straw, and rope.  

Her future goal is to use the loan that is funded by Kiva lenders to elevate her and her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fishing-related products, such as seaweed, straw, and rope.

loans.name: Carmelo

texts.en:
Carmelo is a 32 year old married man with three children, ages five, eight, and 11.  He is from Bien Unido, Bohol and has been involved in the fishing business for two years.  Specifically, he buys and sells sea cucumbers.  

He requests a loan to buy marine plywood, nails, and paint.  He hopes to grow his sea cucumber business with the loan that is funded by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy marine plywood, nails, and paint.

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es: Rosa de 29 años de edad vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 4 y 10 años. Ella es una joven porteña, (oriunda de Puerto Colombia) que siempre ha vivido rodeada de playa, brisa y mar y del amor de su familia. Con su cónyuge emprendieron un negocio mediante el cual vende artículos de la canasta familiar, como víveres, ranchos, abarrotes, refrescos y bebidas, en una comunidad que compra diariamente para el consumo de su familia. Sus principales clientes son las amas de casa, quienes le compran de contado principalmente. Antes de tener este negocio Rosa  intentó conseguir empleo infructuosamente, por eso emprendió en compañía de su cónyuge,  su propia tienda. Al principio tenían muy poca inversión y un surtido incipiente, pero con el paso del tiempo, la disciplina de trabajo y su buen servicio al cliente, lograron capitalizar las utilidades y adquirir activos fijos. El sector donde está ubicada esta tienda es muy popular y se caracteriza por tener muchos niños jugando futbol en sus polvorientas calles y bajo el incesante y acostumbrado sol del caribe; así mismo el alto sonido de la música salsa que a sus pobladores les gusta compartir, hacen parte del paisaje cultural donde convive Rosa, quien en su negocio no tiene competencia, porque está siempre preocupada en ser amable y acomodar a cada cliente teniendo en cuenta su presupuesto. En la actualidad Rosa está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará víveres, para aumentar el surtido e incrementar sus ventas y generar mayores ingresos que continúen beneficiando a su familia.
texts.en: Rosa is 29 and lives with her husband and two children, who are 4 and 10.  She is a young "Porteña" (someone born in Puerto Colombia), who has always lived surrounded by the beach, breeze, sea, and love of her family.  With her husband, they started a business through which they sell items for families, like supplies, food, soft drinks, and beverages, in a community that makes purchases every day for their families.  Her main customers are housewives, who pay mainly with cash.  Before she had this business, Rosa tried to get a job unsuccessfully.  This is why she started the store with her husband.  At first, they had very little investment and a small selection, but as time passed, and with their work ethic and good customer service, they were able to capitalize on their profits and acquire fixed assets.  The area where the store is located is very popular and is characterized by having a lot of kids playing soccer in its dusty streets under the incessant and customary Caribbean sun.  The loud sound of salsa music is also heard, which the townspeople like to share.  This is part of the cultural landscape where Rosa lives.  She doesn't have competition with her business because she is always worried about being friendly and accomodating each customer, keeping their budget in mind.  Currently, Rosa is applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing she has had with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy supplies to increase her selection and her sales and to generate greater income to continue benefiting her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies to increase her selection.

loans.name: Cesar Antonio

texts.es:
Cesar, vive con su esposa y tres hijos, solamente él trabaja, tiene un negocio de productos domésticos, surgió por iniciativa propia, el negocio consiste en la venta ambulante, compra la mercadería y la almacena en su vivienda, todos los días sale a ofrecerla por los alrededores del mercado, no tiene un horario establecido.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería como arroz, aceite, leche, queso, frijoles, para mantener en el negocio, esto le permitirá crecer  y tener nuevos productos para ofrecer.
La aspiración de Cesar es poderse superar con el negocio, tener siempre la buena disposición  de trabajar para apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Cesar lives with his wife and three children. He is the sole breadwinner of the family. He has a business where he sells domestic products. He started this business on his own. It is a door-to-door sales business. He buys merchandise and stores it in his home. Everyday he goes out and sells his goods in the outskirts of the market. He doesn’t have a fixed schedule. He is asking for this loan in order to buy merchandise such as rice, oil, milk, cheese and beans in order to maintain his business. This helps his business grow and gives him new products to sell.
Cesar hopes to move forward with his business. He has a good attitude as a worker and wants to support his family.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, milk, cheese and beans.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a 42 year old married woman with five children, ages, 11, 12, 16, 18, and 22.  She is from Bien Unido, Bohol and has been in the fishing business for 20 years.  Her husband is a fisherman.  

She requests a loan to buy fishing nets.  With the loan that is funded by Kiva lenders, she hopes to elevate her and her family’s standard of living and have the capacity to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a 60-year old woman from Trinidad, Bohol with three children.  She has been in the farming business for 15 years.  Her husband is a farmer.  
She requests a loan to buy fertilizer for her farm.  She hopes to grow her business with the loan that is funded by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Mbooze

texts.en:
Mbooze is a married woman.  She has three children between two and 15 years of age.  She describes herself as determined and aggressive. 

She operates a retail stall where she sells charcoal.  She has been in business for three years.  Her business is located at a residential area and her primary customers are local residents.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be a shortage of charcoal due to restrictions by government on cutting trees for charcoal . 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more charcoal for selling.  Her business goal is to be the largest supplier in Mombasa within 5 years.  She hopes to provide her children with the best education.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for selling.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: Maria  de 44 años vive en Puerto Colombia con sus 3 hijos en las edades de 14 a 24 años. Ella es comerciante desde hace 3 años, cuando inició vendiendo artículos variados como perfumes, juegos de sabanas, ropa y calzado,  entre amigos y vecinos. Posteriormente empezó a vender electrodomésticos juegos de cuarto, etc. . En su negocio le ha ido bien, pues ha logado con su disciplina de trabajo capitalizar sus utilidades, pues cuenta con una fiel clientela que ha construido paulatinamente. Maria es una mujer muy espiritual que expresa su amor a Dios, en cada instante, ella se congrega en una iglesia cristiana y donde gradualmente se enmarca su mejor clientela, a la que ella oportunidades de obtener productos a crédito en plazos ajustados a las posibilidades de ellos. Su meta más adelante es abrir un almacén al público, para exhibir la mercancía que ofrece y ganar cada vez mas nuevos compradores y aumentar su capital de trabajo. En la actualidad Maria está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará televisores, abanicos, juegos de sala y equipos de sonido para responder a los pedidos de su clientela y así hacer que esta inversión sea todo un éxito.
texts.en: Mary is 44 years old. She lives in Puerto Colombia with her three children, ages fourteen to twenty-four. For the past three years she has been in business. When she started her business she sold various articles such as perfumes, sheet sets, clothes and shoes to her friends and neighbors. Lately she has started to sell electronic goods for the household. Her business is going well. With discipline she has been able to increase her sales. She has gradually increased her customer base. Maria is a very spiritual woman that expresses her love of God. She attends a Christian church where she derives good customers. She is able to offer them products on credit with adjustable payments, which broadens her customer’s possibilities. Her future goal is to open a storefront where she can show her merchandise. This is how she can offer more goods and have more customers. In this way she will increase her working capital. This is Maria’s first loan with KIVA and her first loan with Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. She will use this loan to buy televisions, fans, bedroom furniture and sound systems in order to meet her customer’s requests. In this way this investment will be a success.

loans.use: to buy televisions, fans, bedroom furniture and sound systems in order to meet her customer's requests.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (an orphan). 

Edith is a tailor and has been in business for seven years.  Edith works six days a week.  She sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. 

Edith has requested a loan of 300000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, to buy more rolls of clothing materials.  She also generates additional income through a second business.

The main business challenges for Edith include transportation and lack of customers for finished clothes.  

Her goals and aspirations are to own a tailoring school and to educate her children up to university level.  Edith lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but no piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, feeding her family and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more rolls of clothing materials.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol.  She has three children, ages seven, 12, and 20.  

She has been in the fishing business for 20 years.  Her husband is a fisherman.  

The loan that she hopes for, funded by Kiva lenders will be used to buy and sell fish, and a fishing net.  

Her dream is to elevate her and her family’s standard of living and have the capacity to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy and sell fish, and a fishing net.

loans.name: Romenita

texts.en:
Romenita is a 32 year old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol.  She has four children, all girls, ages two, seven, nine, and 11.  

She has been in the fishing business for five years.  Her husband is also in the fishing business.  

She requested a loan to buy a crab net, fresh fish, and dried fish.  With the loan that Romenita hopes will be funded by Kiva lenders, she would like to improve her business.  

Romenita would also like to have the capacity to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy a crab net, fresh fish, and dried fish.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a 49 year old woman from Trinidad, Bohol.  She has owned a “sari-sari” (convenience) store for the past two years.  

She requested a loan to buy groceries and food to sell.  In the future, Rosalinda hopes to improve her ability as a small business owner.  

Rosalinda would also like to inject more capital into her business after this loan is paid back.

loans.use: to buy groceries and food to sell.

loans.name: Martha Luz

texts.es: Martha  de 41 años vive con su esposo y sus 6 hijos en las edades de 4 a 19 años. Ella tienen un negocio mediante el cual produce pasteles y hayacas, amasijos de arroz o maíz, con verduras, cerdo, pollo, envueltos en hojas de bijao. Esta actividad la aprendió desde muy pequeñas en su natal Ovejas, población en el departamento de Sucre, desde donde emigró hacia el norte del país,  buscando oportunidades de bienestar. Cuando inició no todo fue fácil, pues preparaba sus productos y bajo aguaceros generadores de grandes arroyos, salía con su cónyuge a vender en la madrugada, tarde y hasta en la noche. Con todo este trabajo ha logrado salir adelante con su familia y todo gracias al  apoyo de su cónyuge, quien ha estado trabajando de cerca con Martha. Su meta mas adelante es lograr mayores ingresos para llevar a sus hijos a ser profesionales exitosos. En la actualidad su creciente clientela, hace que su capital de trabajo se torne insuficiente para aumentar producir en mas cantidad y esta es  justamente la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, mediante el cual comprará materias primas e insumos, como harina, carnes, verduras y una estufa industrial de dos puestos con la que pueda incrementar su producción y hacer mas efectivo su trabajo. Su capacidad de trabajo y su experiencia en el oficio es el marco que sustenta el éxito de esta inversión con su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.
texts.en:
Martha, who is 41 years old, lives with her husband and their six children, ages 4 to 19. She has a business in which she produces pastries and hayacas, a mixture of rice or corn with vegetables, pork, and chicken, wrapped in banana leaves. She learned this business when she was very young in her native Ovejas, a town in the department of Sucre, from which she emigrated to the north of the country, looking for opportunities for well-being. When she began, everything was not easy, since she prepared her products and, under downpours generating great streams, she went out with her husband to sell them early in the morning, in the afternoon, and even in the night. With all this work, she has succeeded in getting ahead with her family and in everything, thanks to the support of her husband, who has been working closely with Martha.

Her goal for the future is to achieve better income to raise their children to have successful careers. At this time, her growing clientele has made her working capital insufficient to expand and produce in larger quantity, and this is exactly the reason why she has turned to a Kiva loan, with which she will buy basic materials and ingredients, such as flour, meats, and vegetables, and an industrial stove with two burners, which which she can increase her production and make her work more effective. Her capacity for work and her experience in this business are the framework that sustains the success of this investment of her Kiva loan, her first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.

loans.use: to buy basic materials and ingredients, such as flour, meat, and vegetables, and an industrial stove with two burners.

loans.name: Benito

texts.es: El Sr. Benito tiene 41 años y no es casado pero convive con su pareja hace ya 20 años, tiene 5 hijos que son de las edades de  16, 12, 10, 8 y 6 años, el se dedica a la venta de  lubricantes en su negocio que se encuentran en la zona del plan 3000,  este préstamo lo utilizara  para la compra de lubricantes por mayor para surtir su venta y así de esta manera incrementar su capital de  trabajo, el sr. Benito enfrenta retos en su negocio   que son la competencia ya que son varias personas por la zona que se dedican a la venta de lubricantes, pero el trata de brindar una  buena atención a su clientes, les trata con amabilidad y así de  esta manera siempre incrementar su clientes y por ende sus ingresos, y utilizara los beneficios del crédito en mejorar su vivienda y su deseo es que su negocio  sigua creciendo.
texts.en: Benito is 41 and isn't married, but he has lived with his girlfriend for 20 years.  He has 5 children who are 16, 12, 10, 8, and 6.  He makes a living selling lubricants in his business that is located in the plan 3000 neighborhood.  He will use this loan to buy lubricants wholesale to stock his business and to increase his working capital.  He faces challenges in his business, one of which is the competition, because there are various people in the area that sell lubricants.  But he tries to offer good service to his customers.  He tries to treat them with friendliness, and in this way, he always increases his clientele and therefore his income.  He will use the benefits from the loan to improve his home.  His wish is that his business keeps growing.

loans.use: to buy lubricants.

loans.name: Yanira Guadalupe

texts.es:
Yanira, está soltera, vive con su madre, la abuela, se dedica a atender un negocio de productos domésticos, atiende de lunes a viernes, lo administra desde hace un año, pues lo ha heredado de su abuela, ella estudia los fines de semana y le ayudan en su familia para atender el negocio mientras ella estudia.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos de la canasta básica como: aceite, galletas, sopas instantáneas, dulces, esto le ayudara para mantener lo necesario a los clientes, y que las ventas mejoren.
Ella quiere administrar bien este negocio, ampliarlo, mejorar el mobiliario, con el propósito de mejorar las ganancias para la familia.
texts.en:
Yanira is single living with her mother and grandmother.  She tends to a business selling home products from Monday through Friday; she’s had it for a year having inherited it from her grandmother.  On weekends she studies and her family helps her tend to the business while she’s attending classes.

She is asking for a loan at present to buy basic staple items like oil, cookies, instant soups and candy which will help her have what her customers want on hand and to improve sales.

She wants to run the business well, expand it and improve the furnishings with the goal of improving profits for her family.

loans.use: to buy oil, cookies, instant soup and candy.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: La Sra. Norma tiene 52 años, no es casada pero es madre soltera tiene 3 hijos que son 17 - 22 y  25 años, La Sra. Norma se dedica a la venta de tucumanas su negocio se encuentran en su mismo domicilio. Este préstamo es la quinta secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Norma utilizara este préstamo  para la compra de un nuevo carrito para vender tucumanas su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que su carrito ya esta viejo, la Sra.  Norma enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia, ella utilizara los beneficios del crédito  en mejorar su casa, se siente muy agradecida con al institución por el apoyo que le brindan.
texts.en: Mrs. Norma is 52 years old. She is not married but is the single mother of three children who are 17, 22 and 25 years old. She sells meat pastries from her home. This is her fifth loan with this institution. She will use the loan to buy a new, small cart to be used to sell her meat pastries. She is asking for this loan because her existing cart is old.  Norma confronts the challenges of her business with competence. She will use the proceeds of this loan to improve her house. She is grateful to this institution that helps support her dreams.

loans.use: to buy a new, small cart to be used to sell her meat pastries.

loans.name: Rudy Osmin

texts.es:
Rudy, es comerciante de ropa, vive con su familia, sus padres, está soltero, el negocio lo comenzó con el apoyo de unos amigos, trabaja de forma ambulante, no tiene un horario establecido.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de más ropa para la venta como blusas, faldas, camisetas, ropa interior, esta compra le ayudara para surtir el negocio y mantener lo necesario para la clientela.
La aspiración de Rudy es tener un negocio estable, que le genere las ganancias para aportar en el hogar y poder ir creciendo en el mercado.
texts.en:
Rudy is a clothes merchant.  He lives with his family, his parents.  He’s single.  He started the business with support from some friends.  He works in an ambulatory fashion and has no fixed work schedule.

He’s asking for a loan to buy more clothes to sell like blouses, skirts, t-shirts and underwear.  This purchase will help him stock the business and to have what he needs for his clientele.

Rudy’s hope is to have a stable business that generates profits to contribute to the home and to be able to grow in the marketplace.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, t-shirts and underwear.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 45 year old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol with 10 children, ranging in age from three to 25.  

She has been a farmer for over 10 years.  Her husband is also a farmer.  

Teresita requested a loan to buy products such as flour and rice.  Teresita will use the products for her food vending business.  She hopes that the loan, funded by Kiva lenders will enable her business to grow, and provide her with the capacity to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy products such as flour and rice.

loans.name: Jesús El Salvador Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Jesús El Salvador” es un grupo conformado por 07 socios, la gran mayoría vecinos de la zona, la cual llevan 08 meses trabajando con el Programa- Prosperidad. Zonia tiene 47 años, es separada con  02 hijos independientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de frituras como alitas broster, salchipapas y hamburguesas, siendo la gran mayoría de sus clientes personas que viajan al centro del país. Gracias a su arduo trabajo y con la ayuda de sus hijos   Zonia pudo cumplir una de sus metas el de construir su vivienda. Su siguiente meta es de poner un restaurante, pues así asegura ella tendrá mayores ganancias. En esta oportunidad solicito el crédito para comprar insumos para su negocio como pollo, aceite, papa, etc. La Alcancía Comunal “Jesús El Salvador” están agradecidos con el crédito brindado.
texts.en:
Jesús El Salvador Communal Bank is a group made up of seven members, the majority of them neighbors in the area.  They have been working with the Prosperidad program for eight years.

Zonia, 47, is separated with two independent children.  She works selling fried foods such as Broaster-style chicken wings, "salchipapas" [hot dogs with fried potatoes], and hamburgers.  The vast majority of her customers are people who travel to the central part of the country.

Thanks to her hard work and with the help of her children Zonia managed to fulfill one of her goals, building her house.  Her next goal is to set up a restaurant because that will assure that she will have greater profits. 

She is requesting a loan now to buy supplies for her business such as chicken, oil, potatoes, etc.

Jesús El Salvador Communal Bank is grateful for the loan offered.

loans.use: to buy chicken, oil, and potatoes.

loans.name: Milagro De La Paz

texts.es:
Milagro,  solicita un préstamo para la compra de leche a mayor cantidad, este préstamo le ayudara para tener lo necesario tanto en dinero para poder realizar compras periódicas e ir elaborando los productos derivados de la leche, como cuajada, requesón, quesos frescos.
Ella considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudo dándole lo necesario para crecer en el negocio.
texts.en: Milagro is asking for a loan to buy larger amounts of milk.  This loan will help her have money needed to make periodic purchases and make products derived from milk like curd, cottage cheese and fresh cheeses.  She believes that the previous loan helped her by giving her what was needed to make the business grow.

loans.use: to buy milk.

loans.name: Marbel

texts.es: Marbel  de 39 años, tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad y una pequeña confección en su propio barrio, con la que genera ingresos para el sustento de su hogar. Ella aprendió este arte haciendo un curso de modistería y a sus primeros clientes les hacia ropa sobre medidas, así  ellos llevaban la materia prima e insumo, para que Marbel, pusiera su creatividad y elaborara las prendas que estos lucirían. Poco a poco fue ganando prestigio entre sus vecinas y amigas y también fue especializándose en ropa infantil femenina,   multiusos, uniformes y ropa femenina cuando se requiere. Sus principales clientes son misceláneas del sector y almacenes ubicados en el centro de la ciudad de Barranquilla y en grandes superficies, con los que sostiene relaciones comerciales. Su meta más adelante es ampliar su negocio, organizando principalmente su taller, disponiendo de una gran clientela y teniendo empleados para cumplir oportunamente sus compromisos. Su mayor desafío para el cumplimiento de sus sueños, pues  ante la creciente demanda del mercado, su capital de trabajo se torna insuficiente; esta es la razón por la cual está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará materias primas e insumos, para responder a su clientela  y también comprará una maquina industrial   con la cual mejorará su proceso y será mas efectiva en los tiempos productivos y en la calidad de la prenda. El éxito de esta inversión radica es que se justifica en pedidos de sus clientes que son los almacenes a los que Marbel surte y de los cuales planea continuar fidelizando su relación comercial.
texts.en:
Marbel is 39, and has a 3-year-old son. She has a small dressmaking shop in her own neighborhood, through which she generates income to support her household. This learned this skill by taking a dressmaking course, and she sewed made-to-measure clothing for her first customers. They would bring her the raw materials and supplies, so that Marbel could put her creativity to work, and sew the clothing that would make them look good.

Little by little, she gained prestige among her neighbors and friends, and also started to specialize in clothing for little girls, multi-use clothing, uniforms, and also women's clothing when needed. Her main clients are local notions stores, and stores in the center of the city of Baranquilla and in shopping malls, with which she maintains business relationships. 

Her goal is to someday expand her business, primarily by organizing her workshop better. She also wants to have a large clientele, and employees, in order to meet her commitments in a timely way. Her greatest challenge in fulfilling her dreams, is that faced with the growing market demand, her working capital is becoming insufficient. 

This is why she is applying for her credikiva loan, her first from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With the loan she will buy raw materials and supplies in order to respond to her customers. She will also buy an industrial sewing machine, with which she will improve her process, be more productive, and improve the quality of the garment.

The success of this investment lies in the fact that it is justified in terms of customer orders, which are from the stores that Marbel supplies, and whose customer loyalty she plans to continue fostering.

loans.use: To buy raw materials and supplies.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is a 44 year-old married woman who lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with her family.  She and her husband are farmers.

Letecia has been involved in farming for nine years.  She primarily grows rice crops to sell.  

Letecia requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.  

She hopes to continue earning and sustain her children's education.  Letecia also hopes for CEVI and KIVA to continue its programs so more farmers like her could be assisted.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Ma. Lorena

texts.en:
Ma. Lorena fishes for a living.  She is 37 years old, married with five children, ages 14, 11, eight, six and five. 

Her husband is also a fisherman.

Ma. Lorena works with her husband in their fishing business.  They sell their catch at the market.  They also sell crabs.  

She applied for a loan to purchase crab traps, paint for their fishing boat and rice for her family.  Ma. Lorena hopes to have a successful business. 

Ma. Lorena plans to buy home equipment with her extra income.

loans.use: to purchase crab traps, paint for the fishing boat and rice for her family.

loans.name: Felix Antonio

texts.es:
Félix, es agricultor y ganadero, vive con su padre y una hermana, está soltero, en su hogar todo trabajan, este trabajo lo aprendió de su padre, quien se ha dedicado a esta actividad, trabajan juntos, no tiene un horario establecido.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas como el abono y herbicidas, tambien comprara dos terneros, para engordarlos, la compra le permitirá crecer y tener los insumos necesarios para trabajar. 
La aspiración de Félix es obtener una buena cosecha, exitosa y apoyar a su familia
texts.en:
Félix is a farmer and cattleman.  He lives with his father and sister.  He’s single.  In his home, everyone works.  He learned his occupation from his father who has dedicated himself to this line of work; they work together and don’t have a set work schedule.

He’s asking for a loan to buy farm supplies like manure and herbicide.  He will also buy two calves to fatten up.  The purchase will allow him to grow and have the necessary supplies to work.

Félix’s hope is to obtain a good, successful harvest and to support his family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like manure and herbicide.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 41 years old and married woman with six children ages ranging from two to 17. 

Julieta's husband works as a driver.

Julieta is a scrap buyer and reseller.  She has been in this business for 10 years.  Julieta said her monthly income is about 10000 PHP. 

She requested a loan to invest in her business.  She plans to buy more scrap to resell.  

Julieta hopes to become a successful businesswoman in the future.

loans.use: to buy more scrap to resell.

loans.name: Erika Elizabeth

texts.es:
Erika, vive junto a sus dos hijos, la vivienda esta compartida con sus padres, se dedica a la venta de gaseosas, agua, jugos, ella se dedica además a ofrecer oficios domésticos a los vecinos, como lavar, planchar.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería, pues tiene pensado surtir el negocio con boquitas, dulces, con lo que espera mejorar la afluencia de clientes, este préstamo le ayudara para tener más productos, su riesgo son las ventas al crédito que se le hace difícil cobrar a los clientes.
La aspiración de Erika es hacer más grande el negocio, y ayudar a sus dos hijos en el estudio.
texts.en:
Erika lives with her two children in a house that’s shared with her parents.  She sells soft-drinks, water and juices and also offers domestic services like washing and ironing to her neighbors.

She’s asking for a loan to buy merchandise because she’s planning to stock the business with snacks and candy hoping to increase clientele.  This loan will help her have more products.  Her risk is credit sales which are sometimes difficult to collect payment from customers.

Erica’s hope is to expand the business and help her two children with their schooling.

loans.use: to buy snacks and candy.

loans.name: Digna Rosabell

texts.es:
Digna, se dedica a la venta de meriendas y bebidas,  vive con sus hijos, quienes estudian, son dependientes, ella aprendió por cuenta propia el negocio, tiene 3 años en el, con el que apoya en las necesidades del hogar.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materiales para elaborar la comida, plátanos, aceite, yuca, azúcar, gaseosas, jugos, con este préstamo podrá mejorar el negocio y que sus ventas aumenten.
Ella quiere tener un negocio rentable, agregar otro rubro para variar sus productos, tener su propio local de venta, para ir superándose al lado de su familia.
texts.en:
Digna sells snacks and drinks.  She lives with her children; they go to school and are dependents.  She learned the business on her own.  She has had the business for three years, and it supports the household necessities.

She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients to make food, bananas, oil, yucca, sugar, soft drinks, and juices.  With this loan she will be able to improve her business, and her sales will increase.  She wants to have a profitable business, add other items in order to vary her products, and have her own sales location in order to succeed alongside of her family.

loans.use: to buy bananas, oil, yucca, sugar, soft drinks, and juices.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es: El Sr. Reynaldo tiene 26 años y es soltero no tiene hijos, se dedica a la  confección de pantalones jeans en su taller que se encuentra ubicado en la zona 30 de agosto,  Este préstamo es la segunda secuencia dentro de institución  y utilizara este  préstamo  para la compra de tela e insumos para la confección de sus prendas de vestir la razón para solicitar este préstamo es para poder producir mas pantalones y así ofertar sus productos en las distintos mercados, uno de los retos que enfrenta  en su negocio son seguir creciendo y utilizara los beneficios para  producir mas cantidades, su deseo para su negocio es seguir creciendo, es un joven emprendedor esta es la única actividad con la que se mantiene, por esta razón se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Reynaldo, 26, is single and has no children.  He works manufacturing jeans in his shop located in the 30 de Agosto zone.  This loan is the second sequence within the institution and he will use it to buy fabric and supplies to sew his articles of clothing.  The reason for requesting the loan is so that he can produce more pants and offer his products in different markets.  One of the challenges he faces in his business is to continue growing so he will use profits to produce larger quantities.  His wish for his business is to continue growing.  He is a young entrepreneur and this is the only activity he supports himself with and this is why he feels grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy fabric and supplies to make jeans.

loans.name: Martin Mauricio

texts.es: Martin Mauricio es un emprendedor que se dedica a su negocio con mucho esfuerzo lo ha sacado adelante para brindarle a su familia lo mejor y siempre ofreciéndole a sus clientes  variedad de producto. Ella ya es cliente de Fundación León 2000, en los créditos anteriores lo invirtió en el negocio en la compra de mas producto aumentando su inventario y sus clientes de igual manera, actualmente esta solicitante financiamiento para comprar productos  como granos básicos, detergentes, golosina, shampoo,  entre otros productos que más demandan sus clientes.
texts.en: Martín Mauricio is an entrepreneur who puts much effort into his business so that it will make progress in order to provide his family with the best always offering his customers a variety of products.  He is already a Fundación León 2000 client and used previous loans to invest in the business buying more products and increasing his inventory and likewise his clientele.  He is currently asking for financing to buy products like basic grains, detergents, snacks and shampoo, among other products his customers demand.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Ramon Isabel

texts.es:
Ramón, vive en casa propia, con su esposa y 4 hijos, todos estudian, él se dedica a las labores agrícolas, cuenta con el apoyo de los hijos para trabajar, cultiva tres manzanas de terreno desde hace 20 años, lo aprendió de su padre y hoy trababa en lo propio, siembra maíz, frijol, ajonjolí.
El está solicitando un préstamo para el alquiler del terreno y comprara los materiales como el abono, herbicidas, y semilla mejorada, para poder tener lo necesario e iniciar correctamente su labor agrícola.
El objetivo de Ramón es mejorar económicamente, para sacar adelante a la familia, teniendo lo necesario para vivir.
texts.en:
Ramón lives in his own house with his wife and four children.  They all study.  He works in agricultural labor and has the support of his children to work.  He has cultivated three "manzanas" [a manzana = 1.736 acres] of land for 20 years.  He learned it from his father and today he works on his own, growing corn, beans, and sesame.

He is requesting a loan for the rent on his land and to buy supplies such as fertilizer, herbicide, and improved seed to be able to have the necessities and to start his agricultural labor correctly.

Ramón's goals are to improve financially and to get his family ahead, having what is necessary to live.

loans.use: to pay for land rental and to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and improved seed.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es soltera. Vive en el sector denominado Sialupe Baca, en la zona rural de Lambayeque. Su domicilio propio cuenta con servicios de agua y luz. El sector donde vive Isabel es un terreno poblado por aproximadamente 200 familias.
La actividad a la que se dedica Isabel es a la comercialización de chicha, trabajo que aprendió de sus padres, quienes le dejaron ese trabajo como legado. Eso quiere decir que conoce a la perfección su trabajo.
El monto del préstamo será de 1500 nuevos soles, que serán utilizados para adquirir insumos para la elaboración de chicha de jora, especialmente maiz, con lo cual anhela lograr su objetivo.
Isabel es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora, además de muy respetada y apreciada.
texts.en:
Isabel is single.  She lives in a sector called Sialupe Baca in the rural part of Lambayeque.  Her house has water and electricity.  The sector where Isabel lives is an area inhabited by approximately 200 families.

Isabel’s commercial activity is selling chicha [corn based beverage], an occupation she learned from her parents who left her this work as a legacy which means she knows it to perfection.

The loan will be in the amount of 1500 new soles that will be used to buy ingredients to make chicha de jora, especially corn, with which she hopes to reach her objective.  

Isabel is a tenacious, enterprising woman who is very respected and esteemed.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make "chicha de jora" drink.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier es un hombre de 43 años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en el caserío Cruce de Vega, en el distrito de Tambogrande. Vive en la parte rural del distrito, pero cuenta con servicio de luz eléctrica.
La actividad que desarrolla Javier es la agricultura, para lo cual tiene 2.0 hectáreas de terreno agrícola, que ha comprado y de las cuales 1.50 hectáreas son de mango en producción y 0.50 hectáreas de limón que se cosecha semanalmente. Complementariamente trabaja en un fundo de mango, en el cual le pagan mensualmente y con boletas de pago. Su esposa se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral en su domicilio.
El monto del crédito solicitado es de 4000 nuevos soles, los cuales se emplearán para la compra de fertilizantes y agroquímicos para sus cultivos de mango.
texts.en:
Javier is a 43 year old man who is married and has three children in his care.  He lives in his own house located in Cruce de Vega settlement in Tambogrande District.  He lives in the rural part of the district but has electricity.

Javier’s activity is agriculture.  He has 2 hectares of farmland he’s purchased on which he plants mangoes on 1.5 hectares and lemons that are harvested weekly on 0.5 hectare.  He’s also employed on a large mango plantation where he’s paid a monthly salary and also receives vouchers.  His wife raises barnyard fowl at home.

The amount of the requested loan is 4000 new soles that he will use to buy fertilizer and agrochemicals for his mango crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Marina De Jesus

texts.es:
Marina, vive con su familia, su esposo y 4 hijos, solo dos de ellos dependen de económicamente, Marina se dedica a la venta de verduras, el negocio surgió por iniciativa propia, trabaja en el mercado, no tiene un horario establecido.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de verdura fresca como papas, güisquiles, ayote, repollo, plátanos, con esta compra podrá tener surtido el negocio para ofrecer a la clientela.
Ella quiere tener éxito en su negocio, mantenerse estable con sus ventas y aportar a su familia lo necesario.
texts.en:
Marina lives with her family, her husband and four children.  Only two of them depend on her financially.  Marina works selling vegetables.  The business started on her own initiative.  She works in the market and does not have a set schedule.

She is requesting a loan to buy fresh vegetables such as potatoes, chayote, squash, cabbage, and plantains.  With this purchase she will be able to have the business stocked to serve her customers.

She wants to be successful in her business, keep her sales stable, and give her family the necessities.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, chayote, squash, cabbage, and plantains

loans.name: Yaoitcha

texts.fr: Yaoitcha est mariée, âgée de 50 ans et mère de 03 enfants. Elle vend des bols en série et des glacières .Elle voudrait diversifier ses articles et satisfaire les besoins de sa famille, cette désire sera combler par une le financement de Finadev pour un meieux vivre et la continuité de la socolarisation de ses enfants. .
texts.en: Yaoitcha, aged 50, is a married mother of three children. She sells nested bowls and insulated containers (coolers). She would like to diversify her goods and to meet the needs of her family. This desire will be fulfilled by financing from Finadev, for better food provisions and the continuity of her children's education.

loans.use: to buy 5 sets of nested bowls and insulated containers

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa, vive con su esposo y un hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, aprendió junto a su esposo, el le cedió el negocio porque consiguió trabajo en la alcaldía y además es marinero, el negocio tiene 15 años de existir.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de  productos frescos como bananos, manzanas, papas, cebollas, con esto surtir el negocio, tener lo necesario para las ventas y satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes.
La aspiración de Teresa es agregar otros productos al negocio, ampliar el local de venta, mejorar las instalaciones de la vivienda poco a poco a medida avance con el negocio, y que sus ingresos mejoren.
texts.en:
Teresa lives with her husband and one son.  She sells fruits and vegetables for a living.  She learned to do this along with her husband; he left the business to her because he got a job at the mayor's office and he is also a sailor.  The business has been in existence for 15 years.

She is currently asking for a loan to buy fresh produce, such as bananas, apples, potatoes, and onions, to stock her business, have what she needs for sales, and meet her customers' needs.

Teresa's goal is to add other produce to her business, to expand her selling space, to improve the appliances in her home little by little as her business advances, and to improve her earnings.

loans.use: to buy bananas, apples, potatoes, and onions

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth forma parte del Banco comunal “Unidos Emprendemos con Esperanza” perteneciente a la ciudad de Curicó.
Ella se dedica a prestar servicios de belleza, ya que es de profesión estilista, comenta que habilitó su propio salón de belleza al interior de su casa. Y que se dedica a éste rubro desde hace 24 años.
Trabaja de lunes a sábado con un horario flexible, sin embargo los días de más demanda de sus servicios, trabaja en horario continuado.
Comenta que cuenta con un gran número de clientela fija.
